programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Patrick Kielty and Jason Mohammad present from Cardiff, where a huge welcoming party for thousands of football fans is in full swing as the Welsh capital prepares to host the UEFA Champions League final. Musician Cerys Matthews goes behind the scenes at the National Stadium of Wales to see how it's gearing up for the big clash between Real Madrid and Juventus, while football-obsessed comedian Elis James jets off to Madrid in an attempt to track down superstar Welsh player Gareth Bale.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the pressure builds on Jack, he gets a shock with an unexpected arrival. Mick is out to impress as the Carters prepare for a meeting with Fi, while Kim has a proposition for Denise. Patrick and Dot catch up about everything that's been happening.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a special edition from York, as Prime Minister Theresa May and Opposition Leader Jeremy Corbyn are each quizzed on their policies. The two politicians will not debate each other directly, but will instead field questions from audience members on a consecutive basis.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Tom Cruise, currently promoting new movie The Mummy, along with Annabelle Wallis who appears alongside him in the film. Hollywood heart-throb Zac Efron also takes up residency on the sofa to discuss the big-screen revival of 1990s cult TV series Baywatch. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Ditto performs her current single Fire. Providing there's time - and there usually is - Graham will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better stand up to scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: Sliding Doors
programme.desc: A London woman's entire future hinges on whether or not she catches a train. In one version of events, she gets the chance to start afresh and lead a happy new life, but in the other she is stuck supporting her lazy, unfaithful boyfriend. Comedy drama, presenting two parallel stories featuring the same character. Starring Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah and John Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British flying doctor swoops to the rescue after a little boy becomes trapped in machinery and two UK policemen race to catch a dangerous driver on the beach.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate packaging issues with food products, and assess why many people say one well-known product is too difficult to open.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred Paul Ainsworth takes part in the culinary challenge, putting three home cooks through their paces including a test of their butchery skills. Sheree Murphy presents.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Five new teams compete for the last two semi-final places. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin challenge them to finely craft two batches of perfectly uniform miniatures, 36 Fraisiers and 36 verrines, in just 150 minutes. For the final challenge, the teams are required to reinvent a pavlova. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents the latest political news, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman returns with the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: The Salvation Army Family Tracing Unit helps Mary Kitchen from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, track down her estranged brother Lennie, who she lost contact with more than 30 years ago. Plus, 81-year-old retired musician Linda Wright, who only found out she was adopted when she was 20 years old, asks genealogist Charlie Watson to lend a hand in finding out whether she has any living biological relatives.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Patricia picks a bad day to enter the Kielys' den, causing stress for Claire and James McKay. Angela's patience is tested by a sorry shoplifter and a vindictive visitor.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the British tradition of cooking with food hunted from the land and prepare a selection of dishes using rabbit, grouse and venison.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Emily's keepers consider sending her back into the wild when she becomes irritable and overly dominant. Michaela Strachan meets the newest arrival in the sanctuary, happy baby Jipe, and Jonathan Scott follows a recently released herd of 10, which is attacked by a rabid dog.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon follows in the footsteps of travellers who made long, arduous and dangerous journeys to reach Jerusalem, where every year millions of Christians, Jews and Muslims still go to worship. In the Old City, he joins in the ancient ritual of walking along the Via Dolorosa, the route taken by Jesus as He carried the cross to the site of His crucifixion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon begin this leg of their journey in Aberdeen before travelling through the coastal town of Cullen to an auction at Elgin in Moray. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Phil Tufnell, Michael Buerk and Naga Munchetty use their knowledge and debating skills to help Manchester solicitor Paul win the cash prize. Hosted by comedian Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: A team from Strictly Come Dancing takes on the general knowledge champions. Professionals Robin Windsor, Karen Clifton and Kevin Clifton, 2015 champion Jay McGuiness, People's Strictly winner Cassidy Little and former contestant Anthony Ogogo are the ones hoping to dance circles around the general knowledge champions.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Angela Malik, Ally McGrath and Michael Bremner continue their battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Scotland final.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The first week draws to a close at the National Trust's Sherborne Estate in the heart of the Cotswolds, where Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke report live on the latest wildlife action. Martin Hughes-Games and Iolo Williams are in north Wales, where they search for the elusive sand lizard.(n)

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: In the wake of Philip's death, Paula notices some things missing from her home and wonders whether James was somehow involved. Mac's superior is determined to believe it was suicide, so the detective starts digging into James's past - while the handyman himself is struggling to cope living with two warring women. When Crystal accuses Morgan of speaking to the police and reacts violently, James hallucinations get increasingly worse and he goes on the run. Revenge thriller, starring Denise Gough, Tom Hughes and Owen McDonnell.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites Jason Manford, Sara Pascoe, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of `noble rot'. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: England v Bangladesh. Action from the opening match of the tournament, which saw the Group A teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: Jane Austen: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley embarks on a road trip across England to take in some of the places Jane Austen lived in and visited during her lifetime. She aims to demonstrate how Jane's personal experiences influenced the central themes of home and property in her novels, and makes use of detective-work to recreate some of the most important locations that no longer stand. She begins in Stoneleigh Abbey, Warwickshire, retracing a journey that marked one of the many times the Austens veered wildly between wealth and genteel poverty - mirroring the Dashwoods of Sense and Sensibility. Lucy also travels from Jane's birthplace in Steventon, Hampshire, to her brother's grand estate at Godmersham Park - the inspiration for Darcy's Pemberley in Pride and Prejudice, along with Lyme Regis, Bath and Southampton.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Manchester Attack: Terror at the Arena - Panorama.
programme.desc: One week on from the atrocity at the Manchester Arena, Tina Daheley reports on the attack that targeted an audience of thousands of young and teenage girls as they left a pop concert. She hears from concert-goers and parents, and examines the community context and the extremist Islamist links of suicide bomber Salman Abedi, a 22-year-old born in the city to Libyan parents.(n)

programme.title: Dara and Ed's Road to Mandalay
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Ed Byrne explore South East Asia, travelling more than 3,000 miles from Malaysia to Myanmar as they forge their way to the historic city of Mandalay. The comedians begin their journey in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur, where they watch a beauty pageant for chickens and join a mass cycle ride through the city.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: Love is in the air at La Banditaccia, as the group prepare to host their first big event on the farm, a traditional Italian wedding. Faced with the language barrier and different cultural traditions, they find themselves under a great deal of pressure to make sure they get everything right for this very special occasion. As the wedding day dawns, the group faces the challenge of preparing a feast of authentic Tuscan cuisine, hoping to impress a party of 40 discerning Italian guests.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British chopper pilot rushes to the aid of an elderly farmer who is fighting for his life, while two UK policemen discover a darker side to life down under.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville look at hygiene in supermarkets in other shops, finding dirty toilets, faulty fridges and food being sold past its sell-by date.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Top chef Jun Tanaka has his eye on the prize as he puts three home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make the perfect red wine sauce.(n)

programme.title: The World According to Kids
programme.desc: The young members of a choir in Liverpool, a debating club in Bradford and a boxing club in Hackney explore what they think of adults and how they think the world would be different if children were in charge. Eleven-year-old Salim wants to ban book-makers to stop adults from gambling, 10-year-old Sahar talks about her experiences of Islamophobia while wearing her hijab, and Jade causes upset among her friends when she reveals she would save her dog from a sinking ship before any of them. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Jo Coburn appraises the latest events from the General Election campaign trail. Plus, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Yorkshireman Stephen Hills hopes to be reunited with his father Alan, having been apart since the 1984 miners' strike. Plus, the story of 81 year-old Eric Morgan, who only found out he was adopted when signing up for National Service in 1952 and may now have finally made contact with a half-sister.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A violent assault keeps McKay from the five-a-side match, especially as the victim is a known drug dealer. Conor covers for another person's wrongdoing.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Chefs Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey into the history of British food, and in this edition explore breakfast dishes, discovering how the morning meal keeps evolving.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott visits northern Tsavo to determine the extent of the rabies outbreak and the fate of the orphaned elephants, then hurries south to see Emily before she is released back into the wild. In Nairobi, Michaela Strachan reports on babies Jipe and Late, and takes part in an extraordinary football match, where the orphans compete against the keepers.(n)

programme.title: Super Giant Animals
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels across the world to encounter the largest animals he can find and discover the remarkable things their size enables them to do. Highlights include Steve swimming with Nile crocodiles in Botswana, dodging two-ton elephant seals in California and diving with sperm whales in the Caribbean.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon embark on the final stage of their Scottish road trip, beginning in Rait, a small village in Perth and Kinross. They then travel through Dundee and Arbroath before heading to auction in Edinburgh. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Writer and journalist Grace Dent, broadcaster Dan Walker and former BBC royal correspondent Jennie Bond use their knowledge and debating skills to help Pat from Sunderland win a cash prize. Hosted by Patrick Kielty. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: A team comprising children's TV presenter Barney Harwood, former world champion boxer Steve Collins, actor and impressionist Lewis MacLeod, Sky News weather presenter Nazaneen Ghaffar and One Show reporter Alex Riley takes on the general knowledge champions. Presented by Jeremy Vine. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scotland chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Gary Parsons - executive chef at Wimbledon - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Secret discussions and unexpected close encounters occur through the court and beyond as a weary Louis XIV is offered an opportunity to change the course of his conflict with William of Orange. However, it is a face from the King's past that brings his mental crisis to a climax. Tensions increase as mistrustful Madame de Montespan suspects her devout friend Madame Scarron also has feelings for Louis. George Blagden, George Webster, Anna Brewster and Catherine Walker star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect's Victoria Coren Mitchell assumes the mantle as host, inviting veteran Sky News journalist Adam Boulton and the Rev Richard Coles to join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton on the satirical current affairs quiz.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events as the General Election campaign enters its final week. Presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Extended edition of the music programme. Brighton duo Royal Blood return to the show with songs from their highly anticipated second album How Did We Get So Dark, while from south London, influential electro-pop trio the xx perform tracks from their chart-topping I See You LP. New Orleans, bandleader and musician Trombone Shorty presents material from his Parking Lot Symphony album, which continues his style of hard-edged funk that employs brass-band beats, rock dynamics and improvisation in a jazz tradition. Los Angeles, sisters Este, Danielle and Alana, aka Haim, play a couple of numbers from their upcoming second album Something to Tell You. Plus, debuts from one of reggae's newest stars Chronixx, and new country music performer Maren Morris. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Eurythmics, Spandau Ballet, Phil Collins, Fine Young Cannibals, Tears for Fears, Suzanne Vega and Simply Red.(n)

programme.title: Fossil Wonderlands: Nature's Hidden Treasures
programme.desc: Professor Richard Fortey Investigates the remains of an ancient volcanic lake, which contains well-preserved examples of early mammals and giant insects - including bats, dog-sized `dawn' horses and ants as large as a hummingbird. The area also houses what could be the oldest known human ancestor to be found. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Great Village Green Crusade
programme.desc: Documentary about Red Dwarf actor and eco-enthusiast Robert Llewellyn's two-year campaign to persuade the residents of his Cotswolds village, Temple Guiting, to generate more of their own power through renewable sources.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell follow each step of the process as a gas installation is pulled from the North Sea by floating cranes, then taken to Newcastle to be disassembled and recycled. They learn how the components of the platform contribute to the process of gas extraction, and talk to engineers about the emotional impact of working on such a remote facility.(n)

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston explores the forensic advances that have elevated murder weapons from mere instruments to crucial pieces of evidence. She sees how arsenic, the undetectable weapon of choice in the 19th century, was exposed as the killer thanks to one simple chemical test, and finds out how distinctive marks on a victim's skull led to the weapon and, in turn, the killer. Gabriel also looks at the latest forensic developments, from 3-D laser scanning that can reconstruct the sequence of events at the scene of a gun crime to the pioneering chemistry able to determine where in the world someone has been based on just a few strands of their hair.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand looks at how developing technology has taken film soundtracks in new directions and changed perceptions on how they should be made. He tries his hand at playing a theremin, the early Russian instrument that Miklos Rozsa used to evoke a sense of psychological disturbance in Alfred Hitchcock's movies and talks to Vangelis, who shares his inspiration for the Chariots of Fire and Blade Runner scores. The presenter also interviews Walter Murch and Carter Burwell, before Clint Mansell explains how electronic technology allowed him to become an acclaimed composer despite his lack of formal musical training. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: American Epic: Blood and Soil.
programme.desc: The second of three programmes exploring American roots music focuses on gospel, including the story of a South Carolina religious leader who inspired Dizzy Gillespie with his use of music in worship. The programme also examines the music originating in the Mississippi Delta and the coal mining communities of Logan County, West Virginia.(n)

programme.title: The Great Village Green Crusade
programme.desc: Documentary about Red Dwarf actor and eco-enthusiast Robert Llewellyn's two-year campaign to persuade the residents of his Cotswolds village, Temple Guiting, to generate more of their own power through renewable sources.(n)

programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Kool and the Gang, the Pointer Sisters, Grace Jones, Cameo, Bobby Womack, Sade, Alexander O'Neal and Whitney Houston.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: Leonard Sachs chairs the old-time music hall programme, inviting Roy Castle, David Kernan, June Marlow, Deryk Parkin, Alan Randall, and performers from the Players' Theatre, London, to entertain an audience at the Leeds City Varieties. First aired February 2, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.sub-title: Temptations, Michael Jackson and the Real Thing.
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Temptations, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1984.
programme.desc: Contributors including Howard Jones, Nik Kershaw, Paul Young, Nigel Planer and Midge Ure recall the year of big hair and big tunes, when a BBC ban on Frankie Goes to Hollywood's Relax led to an embarrassing gap on the show when it reached the top of the chart. The year saw the rise of one-man acts such as Nik Kershaw and Howard Jones, while Sade brought a stripped-back soulful vibe to jazz pop. German singer Nena hit the top spot with 99 Red Balloons, while the Special AKA's Free Nelson Mandela combined a political message with an irresistible tune. The year ended with the stars of the day pooling their talents with Band Aid's charity single Do They Know It's Christmas?.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1984: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A compilation of performances, featuring the Smiths, Duran Duran, Sade, the Weather Girls, Wham! and Bronski Beat. Further stellar appearances come from the show's debuts of iconic Americans Madonna, Miami Sound Machine and Cyndi Lauper - who runs riot in the studio. Frankie Goes to Hollywood celebrate their chart dominance of the year with one of their celebrated renditions of Two Tribes, while a less credible but arguably more memorable ditty comes courtesy of Black Lace.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: Loretta Lynn - Still a Mountain Girl.
programme.desc: The veteran country music singer-songwriter looks back at her life from being born a coal miner's daughter in Kentucky, to selling over 45 million albums worldwide and to receiving the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Barack Obama in 2013. Contributors include Willie Nelson, Sheryl Crow, Garth Brooks, Jack White and Sissy Spacek.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Poker? I Don't Even Like Her.
programme.desc: Will's friends urge him to tell Grace she cannot play poker with them any more, so she hatches a plan for one last big game. Karen convinces an acquaintance to be a guinea pig for the new shoulder implants she is considering.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray goes to a father-daughter dance and ends up reminiscing about events leading up to Ally's birth. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Madylin Sweeten.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and the family attend an open day at the twins' school, during which first-grader Michael shocks and embarrasses them by reading out a story obviously based on their constant bickering.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier fail dismally in their bid to get tickets for a popular new theatre production, while Daphne achieves the dubious distinction of having a photograph of her bottom appear in a Seattle newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin decides to set Frasier up with Duke's beautiful daughter Marie, but it soon becomes clear she is only interested in him because she needs a psychiatrist and does not want to pay for one. Guest starring Teri Hatcher (Desperate Housewives).(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Maris tries to woo Niles with anonymous presents, but Frasier thinks the gifts were intended for him and risks his latest relationship to learn the identity of his secret admirer. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps a couple from a West Yorkshire village with a love of travelling to find a perfect retirement home on the south coast of Barbados, on a budget of £275,000.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Manchester compete to win the £1,000 prize, including married couple of 19 years Fiona and Ian, who kick off the competition with a Spanish-inspired meal. Later, young newlyweds Lauren and Pete shock their guests with a mature and refined menu, while Karl and Mukta serve up Indian-themed dishes alongside a few surprises.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and Ellie Beardmore look at a dazzling diamond-encrusted mobile phone, a rare German clock, a stunning diamond cluster ring and a solid silver Rococo-style bowl. At Nikolas Patrick in London, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine consider deals on Harry Potter's broomstick and an impressive collection of Manchester United memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Dan Walker swaps the BBC Breakfast sofa for Dictionary Corner as he joins Nick Hewer, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent for the words-and-numbers game.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants choose whether to take the question or nominate in the hope of making it through to the end-of-series final.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help Louisa and Julian, who want to move from their one-bedroom house in Middlesex to a more spacious home in south Devon on a budget of £260,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, where owner Sarah Summers is dreading the arrival of Robert after their confrontation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time drag queen Adam hopes to dazzle his guests with an evening of theatrical flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Apu becomes the proud father of octuplets and enjoys being showered with free gifts from companies that want him to endorse their products - until a couple in nearby Shelbyville go one better by having nine children. Cartoon capers, featuring the voice of former Munsters actor Butch Patrick.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna doesn't want to leave Warren after finding out about the child arrangement order, so decides to make him love her again and tries to seduce him at The Loft. However, she falls to the floor after a tussle with Cindy, which leaves her fearing she may have lost the babies.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A man travels through the night to bring his much-loved doberman down from Cumbria to see Noel Fitzpatrick about a diseased spinal cord. Can the professor and his staff bring the canine back to health? Other cases this week are a cocker spaniel rushed in after being hit by a car and a rabbit that needs surgery for a broken ankle.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: Documentary about Thames Valley Police's investigation into the disappearance of 31-year-old mother of three Natalie Hemming on May 1, 2016. The programme has extraordinary access to the officers as they try to work out whether Natalie is alive or dead, and to her family and friends, struggling with the situation unfolding around them, before an arrest is made and the case reaches its heartbreaking conclusion.(n)

programme.title: One Killer Punch
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the consequences of deadly single hits, from a row over a parking space in a supermarket car park to an unanticipated fight outside a nightclub. By examining three different assaults, the film shows that a single punch can have a colossal effect, often in innocuous locations and circumstances. The programme hears from three accidental killers and observes the circumstances that led up to a fatal punch, how their lives have changed, how their guilt affects them and the complex emotional journey that follows.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: New series. The most unexpected cases from UK A&E departments, beginning with a man who was injured by his own bicycle, and a soldier who took a spill off a bouncy castle. Previously seen on E4.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family-run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business.(n)

programme.title: Grayson Perry: Divided Britain
programme.desc: At the start of 2017, Grayson Perry set out to make art about Brexit. He wanted to seek suggestions, dig into the data and visit the two sides' heartlands. But in the middle of his investigations, Theresa May called a snap election. In this one-off, he tries to uncover the emotions, beliefs and desires that drive people's loyalty to one political tribe or another.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: Watto is ecstatic when his errant mum Pauline arrives back on the scene, seemingly oblivious to her son's multimillion-pound fortune and claiming to have made one all of her own. The boys are initially impressed, but Ewan's growing suspicions lead him to stage an intervention that goes horribly awry. Casey announces that her boss is flying to London specifically to hear Josh and Leon's ideas for the new game, and is rattled when she learns that they have nothing to pitch.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Surrey, where Susie and Andy Clark's house is set to be demolished. However, the couple are still looking for a new home after 18 months of searching. Meanwhile, first-time buyers Sam Summers and Jess Jeary have a firm idea of what they want, but need help turning their dreams into a reality.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Words-and-numbers game, presented by Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley, with Dan Walker joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will receives a piano from Grace to cement their friendship, and Jack deals with a relationship break-up by writing homoerotic novels - which have an interesting effect on Karen. American comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: A new neighbour's habits upset Grace, so she dispenses some romantic advice, hoping it will help him return to his girlfriend. Will and Jack struggle to decide what to do when Karen dumps her elderly mother-in-law on them. Woody Harrelson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank becomes jealous when Marco begins spending time with Marie, and insists they end their friendship. His actions get the backing of Ray, who does not approve of married women having male pals - especially not his mother. Starring Ray Romano and Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray loses his wedding ring and is propositioned by an attractive woman at the airport, so a jealous Debra decides to get her own back - with disastrous results. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles's expensive divorce leaves him penniless, forcing him to move into Frasier and Martin's apartment. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Seal Who Came to Dinner.
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier prepare for a dinner party at Maris's beach house, but a bizarre turn of events results in them having to devote all their time to disposing of a dead seal that has washed up on the shore.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Unemployed Roz is reduced to borrowing money from Frasier, but he thinks she is spending it irresponsibly. Meanwhile, rumours circulate that KACL is rehiring staff. Comedy, starring Peri Gilpin and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Brooklyn, New York, to tackle a 55-year-old family business. Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Their success meant they could afford to purchase the location next door in the 1990s, naming it Mama Maria after John's mother, who died in 2002. But when he lost his father as well, John became overwhelmed by the responsibility of running both establishments and his livelihood is at risk.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Jacqueline Priddin's parents moved to the Costa del Sol, she and husband Anthony have dreamt of also buying a place there for them and their daughter Izzy. Now they have decided to make that happen, so Ben Hillman shows them five homes in the inland area west of Malaga that suit their £50,000 budget. But will it be a town house or a rustic finca that wins them over?.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Greater Manchester compete to win the £1,000 prize, including Amy and Matt, who kick off the competition with a varied menu that causes chaos in their kitchen. The second dinner party of the week sees Paula and Andy prepare a selection of family favourites, but Sharon's husband Simon raises a few eyebrows when he makes a frank admission at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a set of rare commemorative stamps signed by legendary astronaut Buzz Aldrin, an upcycled burger van and a huge diamond ring. In Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine check out an antique dentist chair, while a possible deal on an £18,000 beach hut is enough to get Charlie on a trip to the seaside.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Coastal enthusiast David Bull and countryside fan Kirsty Duffy advise a couple wishing to invest £300,000 in a property in East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day sees the B&B owners meet for the last time, with the Brighton Surf Hotel's Jeremy and Elena Mann wanting to defend their no-breakfast remote-hosting concept.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer wins a vintage motorcycle and forms his own gang - only to encounter trouble in the form of tough bikers the Hell's Satans, who kidnap Marge. Featuring the voices of John Goodman and Henry Winkler.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie gets her job back at the salon where she and Jesse reconnect, while Jesse is relieved when Darcy shows up to help at the busy hairdressers. Jealous of Jesse and Goldie's closeness, Darcy comes up with a plan.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou gets stopped in his tracks test driving a £30,000 Radical racing car, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett deals with an intriguing enquiry about a piece of pop art, while handbag expert Claudia Valentin is moved to tears by a client with an emotional story. James also values a tiara belonging to a martial arts fan, which could be worth £40,000.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedian and presenter Sue Perkins for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days, with a special focus on the General Election. The quartet offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Richard Osman, Ellie Taylor, Jessica Knappett, David O'Doherty, Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Jimmy Carr hosts.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi turns referee to settle a problem between Donna, the manager of Redditch hotel The Blue Inn, and the owner, who monitors her every move on CCTV cameras from her office more than 400 miles away in Paris. Despite having 15 staff, Donna works 100 hours a week and insists on getting too hands-on, so Alex asks her to devise a plan to get more heads on beds before they cross the Channel to see the boss.(n)

programme.desc: Stewart and Elmor attempt to collect £5,000 owed by a debtor in north Wales, but the situation spirals out of control when a group of friends try to take on the agents. Meanwhile, Del and Dael head to south-east London to chase nearly £7,000 owed by a man to his ex-girlfriend, before visiting a woman who owes her solicitor almost £4,000 after a compensation claim went wrong. In Manchester, Stewart and Vic face a hostile reception at a family-run garage that owes £6,000 in professional fees.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Morag wants to appeal against John's sentence, but Marilyn sees a different side of him in an incident in prison. James urges Roo to get a professional opinion about her health.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Elly tries to gather evidence to bring Finn down, Lauren chastises Jack for letting Paige go off alone, and Jack wrestles with his decision to leave the Church.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A special agent disappears during an undercover assignment, forcing the team to work alongside the LAPD in a case that involves human-trafficking, money-laundering and drugs. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Alone in the Wild: Deadly Survival
programme.desc: After a plane crash leaves them stranded in the Canadian wilderness, young siblings Hannah and Zach battle all that nature has to throw at them. Alongside trusty dog Chinook, the duo face bears, wolves and a raging wildfire in their bid to find safety. Family drama, starring Natasha Henstridge and Ted Whitall, with CJ Adams and Erin Pitt as the stranded youngsters.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.sub-title: Party Election Broadcast: UK Independence Party: 1/6/2017.
programme.desc: By the UK Independence Party.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Historian Dan Jones heads south east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.sub-title: The Great Fire: Death and Destruction.
programme.desc: The team continues to walk the path of the infamous inferno, uncovering what really happened on the worst day of the four-day rampage. Dan Jones charts the destruction of the city's buildings, including London's spiritual home St Paul's Cathedral, which burned so fiercely its stones exploded. Suzannah Lipscomb reveals how Pudding Lane baker Thomas Farriner made sure no blame landed on him and Rob Bell finds out how the fire moved so fast.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Catching up with the victims and villains of the housing rental market. Rachel intended to rent out her Snowdonia cottage for only three months. Four years later her tenant is still there and not paying any rent. Plus, the stories of Stevenage landlord Derek, whose tenant Kellie proved so troublesome that the police had to be called, and Claud from south London, who was left £30,000 in debt when a professional couple split up.(n)

programme.title: Extraordinary People
programme.sub-title: The World's Heaviest Child: Extraordinary People.
programme.desc: The story of 11-year-old Arya Permana from Indonesia, who weighs a massive 30 stone - nearly three times that of an average man. His status as the world's heaviest boy has brought fame and considerable financial benefits - but when he becomes house-bound and his health begins to deteriorate, his parents realise they must seek medical help. Can the doctors' tests get to the root cause of the boy's extraordinary weight gain?.(n)

programme.title: Restless Legs Syndrome: Desperate for Help
programme.desc: Documentary about people with a compulsion to constantly move their feet. It's a condition so severe for some that they want to have their legs chopped off. Cameras follow the pensioner who contemplates suicide due to severe sleep deprivation caused by his tingling legs, and the sufferer who is housebound due to the embarrassment of her wriggling legs.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Simone is back inside Wentworth and sets her sights on weakening Franky's position as top dog by searching for a way to smuggle drugs into the prison following Ferguson's crackdown on narcotics. Doreen begins to grow closer to a fellow inmate who shares her interest in gardening, while Bea is determined to murder Brayden Holt. Drama, starring Alexandra Fowler and Nicole da Silva.(n)

programme.title: Now That's Funny
programme.desc: Another selection of internet-sourced videos, including a woman attempting to break a world record with marshmallows and holiday-makers travelling to unwise destinations.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton look back over highlights from the series. A two-bedroom semi in the Black Country made quite an impression, thanks to the unmistakable smell of dogs and a large collection of dolls, as did a cottage in Northamptonshire that seemed to have four sitting rooms.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski, Professor of the History of Medieval Art at Cambridge University, examines the Italianate frescoes at Chalgrove's 14th-century parish church in Oxfordshire. He then views more pre-Reformation treasures in Ranworth, Norfolk, where the church has a finely painted rood-screen and an altar dedicated to women.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily and Bull leave a gate open while playing chase, and all the sheep create havoc after wandering out of the field.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: A fallen apple inspires Mofy to write a song, but she is having trouble finishing it. When Kerry invites her to his house for tea, she hopes he can help.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa go ice skating, but they have never been before and Peppa keeps falling over.(n)

programme.desc: Mayor Goodway, Chickaletta, Rocky and Skye go camping to earn their Pup Scouts badge, but when Chickaletta gets stuck in a crevice, the Paw Patrol comes to the rescue.(n)

programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Broken Xylophone Bridge.
programme.desc: Noddy and Big Ears find that someone has broken a key on the xylophone bridge, and try to fix it with sticky tape.(n)

programme.sub-title: Pups Save the Three Little Pigs.
programme.desc: The Patrol helps three little pigs to build new houses. Animated action adventure following a squad of six heroic puppies and their tech-savvy 10-year-old leader.(n)

programme.desc: George and Peppa help Daddy Pig look for his glasses.(n)

programme.desc: Kerry, Mogu and the squirrels win in the Forest Games of Skill day, but Mofy disappoints herself at not doing very well in the competition.(n)

programme.desc: The youngster asks Peggy to help after Monty complains that his meerkat colony is overcrowded.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: A big cloud floats over Daddy's garden party, and Wanda and Alien try and bring it down to Earth.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits the Harrogate Motel in North Yorkshire, where the owners are deliberately not telling their guests that the establishment is situated in the middle of a muddy equine centre. Mother and son duo Jennifer and Drew Birtwistle are horse lovers first and hoteliers second, but despite providing five-star accommodation for horses, the bedrooms are leaving the guests far from happy. Alex steps in and demands the owners start being more upfront about what they are offering, and tries to turn the horse-loving hosts into hospitality pros.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Essex, Del and Dael try to collect nearly £3,000 owed by an Indian takeaway, but tempers flare when they threaten to seize kitchen equipment. Meanwhile, Paul and Steve evict a tenant who is £14,000 in rent arrears, and in Surrey, Del and Dael chase nearly £4,000 owed by a car dealer to a dissatisfied customer. Finally, in west London, two agents face one of their trickiest evictions to date, with their arrival at a young couple's flat coming as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo introduces James to everyone at Olivia's birthday party, but it transpires later that he took the shot of John that accompanied a disparaging feature in the day's Coastal News.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie's fears escalate after receiving a disturbing letter from Sonya, Aaron suffers a crisis of confidence, and Ben investigates to see how trustworthy Finn really is.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The officers race against time to track down a highly specialised hit squad that has murdered an agent on assignment in Cyprus, desperate to intervene before a second target is killed. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Justice for Natalee Holloway
programme.desc: A mother trying to find out what became of her missing daughter receives a message from the last man to see her alive, offering to sell the location of her body. She helps the FBI to track him down, only to realise that he may be responsible for a murder that occurred on the anniversary of the disappearance. Fact-based crime drama sequel, starring Tracy Pollan and Stephen Amell.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie's fears escalate after receiving a disturbing letter from Sonya, Aaron suffers a crisis of confidence, and Ben investigates to see how trustworthy Finn really is.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo introduces James to everyone at Olivia's birthday party, but it transpires later that he took the shot of John that accompanied a disparaging feature in the day's Coastal News.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.sub-title: Party Election Broadcast: The Liberal Democrats: 02/06/2017.
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The time has arrived for Georgie Barrat to see how far Monkey Tree FC have come from avoiding relegation, as she finds out which tech worked best - as well as deliver one final push. Jon Bentley pits the Amazon Echo against the Google Home to see how they match up to being a music player, personal assistant and home automation controller. In London, Ortis Deley gets the lowdown at the world's best virtual reality show. As well as the latest consumer gadgets, he visits a series of VR worlds that show how advanced technology will be used in the not-so-distant future.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.sub-title: The Great Fire: A City Rebuilt.
programme.desc: The final episode follows the last day of the Great Fire's rampage through the city of London, and the after-effects that changed the capital city for ever. The team investigate the treatment for burns victims, and how authorities dealt with the 100,000 refugees made homeless. Finally, they walk through some of the streets where the fire's impact still endures, and look at how London was rebuilt from the ashes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Long-Haul Flight
programme.desc: Documentary following one of the planet's longest flights - from London to Sydney - aboard one of the world's biggest planes, the double-decker Airbus A380. Filmed before, during and after the flight, it features the confessions of the cabin crew, the secret areas of the plane that are off-limits to passengers, and the technological wizardry that allows each aircraft to be monitored for every second of its 11,000-mile journey. Food is cooked, delivered and prepared at 40,000 feet, while a vast army of people runs the cargo, loads the animals and services the aircraft - all against the clock.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: In June 1985, TWA flight 847 made a routine stop-off in Athens, Greece. Its destination was Rome, but that changed after armed Lebanese militia boarded the plane. Against the backdrop of the Middle East conflict, the terrorists had one objective in mind - the release of hundreds of Islamic prisoners detained in Israel. Seizing the US airliner shortly after take-off, the passengers and crew - including singer Demis Roussos - endured a three-day ordeal involving a stream of landings across various airports. This documentary recalls their experiences.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and also features footage of reckless and dangerous drivers.(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: (2002) Ben Affleck stars as CIA agent Jack Ryan in Paul Alden Robinson's adaptation of Tom Clancy's novel. Ryan faces a race against time to track down terrorists who have acquired a nuclear weapon and plan to detonate it at the Super Bowl, implicating the Russians as the perpetrators and triggering a nuclear exchange(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Savory blend of comedy, drama and romance stars the captivating Catherine Zeta-Jones as a workaholic New York City chef who must deal with taking charge of her orphaned 9-year-old niece (Abigail Breslin) and a free-spirited coworker (Aaron Eckhart) who has intruded on her kitchen and, in typical opposites-attract fashion, found his way into her heart. The film is a remake of the 2001 German hit "Mostly Martha." Patricia Clarkson, Bob Balaban, Jenny Wade. Directed by Scott Hicks(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him in the middle of the Pacific. An elemental drama of hope and survival(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Satirical action drama set in the aftermath of the Gulf War. Four soldiers, finding a map indicating the location of secret bunkers inside the Iraqi border, go AWOL and head for the bunkers to get the gold looted from Kuwait which they believe to be hidden inside. However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Horror tale in which a group of teenagers who believe they have cheated death find themselves at the mercy of an unknown force that seems intent on killing them off one by one. When one of the group's violent prophecy is fulfilled in the form of a plane crash, he and the others who left the flight are subjected to paranormal horror(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Darry and Trish spend the long hours of their road trip bickering and scoring points off each other. There doesn't seem to be anyone else on their remote country road, until a maniacal driver scares them witless. Old-fashioned terror with some great suspense(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Returning from a routine mission to repair a satellite, astronaut Spencer Armacost briefly loses radio contact with mission control. Spencer lands safely back on Earth, but as time passes his wife's anxiety grows - her husband seems somehow different since his return. And what are the implications for the twins she is now carrying?(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Taut drama about an ambitious young stockbroker who is seduced by money and power when he hooks up with a high-powered company trader. But he faces a crisis of conscience when he discovers the truth behind the trader's bid to buy up an airline for which his father is a union rep. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for Best Actor for his portrayal of Gordon Gekko - the personification of 80s greed(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Sergeant Tom Highway, a hardened, tough veteran of Korea and Vietnam returns to the United States for his last tour of duty with the U.S Marine Corps. He is assigned to training a reconaissance unit(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: To clear his criminal record a former LA cop must infiltrate the Miami street racing scene to set up a drug baron. Burning rubber all over the city with his ex-con friend, he attempts to deliver the crook to the FBI without crashing and being blown to pieces in one of the many explosions(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul (Ethan Hawke), headed to Mexico with his faithful collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang of misfits and finds himself exiled by the town marshal (John Travolta), which sparks a bloody quest for revenge. Karen Gillan and Taissa Farmiga co-star. Ti West wrote and directed this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the third and equally fun entry in the popular pulp-adventure series, Rick O'Connell (Brendan Fraser) and wife, Evelyn (Maria Bello), find themselves in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex (Luke Ford), and, of course, a troublesome mummy. This time he's a centuries-old Chinese emperor (Jet Li) with a vast undead army. Michelle Yeoh, Jonathan Carnahan, Zi Juan(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Blood and Wine
programme.desc: Modern-day film noir, set in Miami, about a wine merchant and a jewel thief who plan the theft of a one million dollar diamond necklace. But things go awry when the wine merchant's wife and son decide to leave him - unwittingly taking the stolen necklace with them(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: (2002) Ben Affleck stars as CIA agent Jack Ryan in Paul Alden Robinson's adaptation of Tom Clancy's novel. Ryan faces a race against time to track down terrorists who have acquired a nuclear weapon and plan to detonate it at the Super Bowl, implicating the Russians as the perpetrators and triggering a nuclear exchange(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Savory blend of comedy, drama and romance stars the captivating Catherine Zeta-Jones as a workaholic New York City chef who must deal with taking charge of her orphaned 9-year-old niece (Abigail Breslin) and a free-spirited coworker (Aaron Eckhart) who has intruded on her kitchen and, in typical opposites-attract fashion, found his way into her heart. The film is a remake of the 2001 German hit "Mostly Martha." Patricia Clarkson, Bob Balaban, Jenny Wade. Directed by Scott Hicks(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him in the middle of the Pacific. An elemental drama of hope and survival(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Satirical action drama set in the aftermath of the Gulf War. Four soldiers, finding a map indicating the location of secret bunkers inside the Iraqi border, go AWOL and head for the bunkers to get the gold looted from Kuwait which they believe to be hidden inside. However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Horror tale in which a group of teenagers who believe they have cheated death find themselves at the mercy of an unknown force that seems intent on killing them off one by one. When one of the group's violent prophecy is fulfilled in the form of a plane crash, he and the others who left the flight are subjected to paranormal horror(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Darry and Trish spend the long hours of their road trip bickering and scoring points off each other. There doesn't seem to be anyone else on their remote country road, until a maniacal driver scares them witless. Old-fashioned terror with some great suspense(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Returning from a routine mission to repair a satellite, astronaut Spencer Armacost briefly loses radio contact with mission control. Spencer lands safely back on Earth, but as time passes his wife's anxiety grows - her husband seems somehow different since his return. And what are the implications for the twins she is now carrying?(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Taut drama about an ambitious young stockbroker who is seduced by money and power when he hooks up with a high-powered company trader. But he faces a crisis of conscience when he discovers the truth behind the trader's bid to buy up an airline for which his father is a union rep. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for Best Actor for his portrayal of Gordon Gekko - the personification of 80s greed(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Sergeant Tom Highway, a hardened, tough veteran of Korea and Vietnam returns to the United States for his last tour of duty with the U.S Marine Corps. He is assigned to training a reconaissance unit(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: To clear his criminal record a former LA cop must infiltrate the Miami street racing scene to set up a drug baron. Burning rubber all over the city with his ex-con friend, he attempts to deliver the crook to the FBI without crashing and being blown to pieces in one of the many explosions(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul (Ethan Hawke), headed to Mexico with his faithful collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang of misfits and finds himself exiled by the town marshal (John Travolta), which sparks a bloody quest for revenge. Karen Gillan and Taissa Farmiga co-star. Ti West wrote and directed this Western thriller(n)

programme.desc: Amy vanishes shortly before she is due to take her sergeant's exam, leaving Jake and Rosa with just a few hours to find her and bring her back to sit the test before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess takes matters into her own hands when her sister Abby announces that she has decided to stay in Los Angeles on a permanent basis. Meanwhile, Winston tries to keep his nerves under control when he goes to collect his LAPD entrance exam results. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess re-evaluates her and Nick's need for space and independence. Meanwhile, Cece worries that Abby is taking advantage of Schmidt's generosity when the pair's relationship pushes forward at an unusually fast speed. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is hurt to discover Penny and Bernadette went shopping for bridesmaid dresses without her. She first turns to a reluctant Sheldon for comfort and later tries to drown her sorrows. Comedy, starring Mayim Bialik and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny endure an awkward night at the cinema, both insisting the outing is not a date. Meanwhile, a terrified Sheldon enlists his friends' help when a bird flies into his apartment, but his behaviour soon leaves them exasperated. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie gets her job back at the salon where she and Jesse reconnect, while Jesse is relieved when Darcy shows up to help at the busy hairdressers. Jealous of Jesse and Goldie's closeness, Darcy comes up with a plan.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Everyone gathers for Penny and Leonard's second wedding ceremony - the morning after Leonard's father and Sheldon's mother spent the night together.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard has a meeting with Colonel Williams, a representative from the Air Force Department of Material Command, about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon. Penny accidentally reveals that Bernadette is pregnant to their colleagues at work. Dean Norris guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon joins his girlfriend Tara on a visit to see her sister at university, so the other boys invite themselves along too. Comedy, starring Joe Thomas and Hannah Tointon.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon learns of a machine that will help him understand human emotions. Penny tries to help her brother get a job, and Raj asks his ex-girlfriends why he is still single.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard send Sheldon on a train journey to keep him away from their Air Force project - but the plan backfires. Bernadette has her first night out since having the baby.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: Kelly needs Sketch's help to remove a lower-back tattoo that she feels is getting in the way of her job as an Instagram model, while Alice assists Liam, whose drunk internet shopping led to him having a DIY tattoo disaster. programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Interviews with the people responsible for impressive, outrageous and astounding internet clips. Including a British 'fluteboxer', a Norwegian video editor, a drive-through rapper and a tongue-sewing artist - plus a countdown of the 20 most popular online videos.(n)
