programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Adam hires Jennifer to design a new brochure for a client and, despite a warning from Russell, soon finds out that business and pleasure do not mix. Comedy, starring David Spade and Oliver Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff becomes obsessed with losing weight so he can qualify for a better rate on his life insurance, while Jennifer is upset to learn Adam is seeing a former girlfriend. Comedy, starring David Spade and Oliver Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Joe fears that being a nanny will prevent him from having a love life, so a worried Mel lies to get him a date with her former sorority sister. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna doesn't want to leave Warren after finding out about the child arrangement order, so decides to make him love her again and tries to seduce him at The Loft. However, she falls to the floor after a tussle with Cindy, which leaves her fearing she may have lost the babies.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.sub-title: Coach Trip - Road to Marbs: The Finale.
programme.desc: The final day of the high-speed reality contest sees the coach finally roll into Marbella. Brendan blows the budget with a visit to a beauty salon before taking the tourists to a private boat party. Later, at an emotional vote, the winners are revealed. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben receives an anonymous note from a former love interest asking for a second chance, and does everything he can to find the mystery girl. Danny tries to get Riley back after a misunderstanding, while Tucker, Riley and Bonnie enter Emma into a baby beauty pageant so Tucker can use the footage for the news segment of his TV show - though Riley takes things too far.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: When Ben's first date with a new flame doesn't go well, Danny and Riley step in to help sort out the couple's issues, but their assistance quickly causes more harm than good. Tucker decides to tell his father about his new relationship with Renee - who is one of his father's colleagues - but starts to worry when he learns that his father may have romantic feelings for Renee too.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Russell's father visits New York and makes a surprise proposal. Jeff and Audrey come to regret their decision to allow Adam and Jennifer to share their bathroom for a week after the couple's water supply is turned off. Comedy, starring David Spade and Patrick Warburton.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jennifer and Adam consider buying their apartment, and Audrey and Jeff offer to write a letter of recommendation - but their good deed backfires. Bianca Kajlich and Oliver Hudson star.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Joe fears that being a nanny will prevent him from having a love life, so a worried Mel lies to get him a date with her former sorority sister. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel disapproves of a boy Lennox has started dating, despite seeing `a bad boy' herself. Meanwhile, Joe takes it upon himself to tidy his employer's closet. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: When Tucker hears that his ex-girlfriend Sondra is newly single, he confides in Ben that she was `the one that got away' and they come up with a plan for Tucker to win her back. Bonnie and Riley bond at the department store sales and Danny tries to baby-proof the apartment.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Danny and Ben are eager to find out the gender of Riley's baby, even though she would prefer it to be a surprise, but their quest creates a series of mix-ups. Riley fights for Brad's freedom in his final trial, and Tucker auditions to appear in a new courtroom reality series.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted's attempt to bond with Zoey's husband, the Captain, goes wrong when he finds himself alone with him at sea - and begins to fear for his life. Meanwhile, Marshall tries to conquer his fears about spending time alone with Robin. Sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, with Kyle MacLachlan (Twin Peaks).(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: News that Marshall and Lily are expecting a child has a profound effect on the gang, while the couple themselves are thrown into a panic. Robin has to choose between two very different jobs, and Barney is torn between making a donation to charity or buying a diamond suit. Comedy, starring Jason Segel and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess is given cause to question whether teaching is the right career for her when she is offered a well-paid job working as a fundraiser for a children's museum. With the pressures of her current role mounting, and with less than an hour to decide whether to take the new position, she seeks advice from her friends, and the guys take the opportunity to reminisce about some of their experiences in the workplace. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess pretends to support a basketball team as a way of befriending Coach - upsetting Nick, who follows a rival club. Meanwhile, Schmidt is assigned to mentor Ed, a colleague at work, and Winston seeks a new career path. Comedy, with Zooey Deschanel and guest starring Bob Gunton.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part one of two. A prison van crash sees a mass escape of convicts take place and the entire squad has to track the villains down. Peralta and Santiago make a bet on which of them can bring in the most escaped prisoners, with the loser forced to move into the winner's apartment when they start living together. Former American football star Marshawn Lynch guests.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part two of two. Only one fugitive remains on the loose on the streets of Brooklyn after the mass escape of convicts from the prison van and Peralta is forced to enlist a surprising ally in order to apprehend him. Elsewhere, Santiago and Gina attempt to introduce Boyle to proper texting etiquette. Craig Robinson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is caught in a battle of wills between Sheldon and Penny, while Leonard tries to reignite his long-distance relationship with Priya, who has moved back to India. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard inadvertently gives the impression he is attracted to Amy when he accompanies her to a colleague's wedding. Meanwhile, Howard tries to persuade Bernadette they should live with his mother after getting married and suggests a trial run of the arrangement over the weekend.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney tries to show his father it was a mistake to give up on his hard-partying lifestyle in favour of settling down - and decides to tell a few lies to make his friends' lives seem more exciting than they really are. Robin bumps into a man on whom she secretly has a crush. Comedy, with John Lithgow (3rd Rock from the Sun).(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall enrages Barney by representing Zoey in her bid to save the Arcadian, resulting in an argument that threatens to split the group apart - so Robin and Lily decide to reconcile their friends by exploiting their shared love of alcohol. Meanwhile, Ted takes Zoey on a romantic break, but not to the destination she had expected. Sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, Neil Patrick Harris, Jason Segel, Alyson Hannigan and Cobie Smulders.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Detective Jake Peralta and his eclectic group of colleagues at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. That all changes when tightly wound Captain Ray Holt takes over, determined to make the dysfunctional squad into the best in the borough. Pilot episode of the American comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is assigned to a minor graffiti case by Captain Holt as punishment for turning up late for work, but the investigation becomes a major headache when the vandal's identity is revealed. Meanwhile, Gina's psychic friend Carlene visits the precinct to help with a case, and upsets Charles with a prediction about his romantic life. American comedy, starring Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess hires Coach as her school's new volleyball instructor, but then immediately has to get rid of him. Meanwhile, Schmidt finds himself being sued, and Cece catches the eye of a much younger man. Sitcom, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess and Nick face some truths about their relationship. Schmidt, Winston and Coach scramble to make a better second impression on their attractive new neighbours, and Cece sends a drunken text. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Comic-book store owner Stuart asks Amy out on a date, forcing a jealous Sheldon to consider the future of his relationship with her. Meanwhile, the scientists become obsessed with an unusual new card game, and Penny organises a round of Twister. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard confronts the man who tormented him in high school, while Penny realises she did her fair share of bullying in the past and calls the people she targeted to apologise. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace and Warren end up in a tricky situation when two armed thugs handcuff them to a pipe in the office of The Loft. Meanwhile, Darcy is still playing games with Jesse, and Esther spots a hooded figure watching her and gives chase.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Sun
programme.desc: Using satellite images and the expertise of Britain's leading solar scientists, Kate Humble and Helen Czerski investigate the inner workings of the star and the influence its cycles of activity have on Earth. They reveal the sun is more active now than it has been for a decade, sending out super-heated plasma and waves of radiation, and examine why some experts think longer-term changes in its behaviour may have powerful effects on the world's climate.(n)

programme.title: Nova: Chasing Pluto
programme.desc: Documentary detailing planetary scientists' efforts to send a probe into the deepest reaches of outer space. On July 14, 2015, the New Horizons spacecraft was scheduled to fly by Pluto, aiming to take the first-ever detailed pictures of the dwarf planet. The craft was also intended to make dramatic new discoveries about the vast realm of icy bodies situated beyond Neptune - considered to be relics from the earliest days of the Solar System. Here, researchers discuss what they hoped New Horizons might be able to tell them about other alien worlds.(n)

programme.title: Voyager: To the Final Frontier
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell tells the story of the Voyager Space Mission, which saw two unmanned spacecraft leave Earth to explore the farthest reaches of the solar system. The probes were launched in 1977, and became the first man-made objects to visit Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune and Uranus. Having travelled 11 billion miles to date, the pair now journey beyond the influence of Earth's sun, bearing a record of human civilisation in case of discovery by other species.(n)

programme.title: Can We Make a Star on Earth
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox embarks on a global tour to discover why, after decades of research, nuclear fusion has not yet become a feasible source of energy.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Sun

programme.title: Swallowed by a Sinkhole
programme.desc: Looking at the sinkhole which opened up beneath a house in Florida in February 2013, including why the geology of the state makes it the sinkhole capital of the world.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Cosmic Dawn - The Real Moment of Creation.
programme.desc: The scientific story behind the moment the first stars appeared in the universe, known as the Cosmic Dawn, which transformed the dark world originally created by the Big Bang. Astronomers now have the tools to explore this dramatic event that created the first ingredients of life as we know it, when the first stars were born to light up the universe. With contributions by Professor Tom Abel, Professor Volker Bromm, Charmaine Green and Margaret Whitehurst.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at some of the world's strongest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: What on Earth Is Wrong with Gravity?.
programme.desc: Physicist Dr Brian Cox tries to solve the centuries-old mystery of gravity. Unconventionally competing with Newton and Einstein, he starts in Texas, firing a laser at the moon, before moving on to a sat-nav in Denver and a Louisiana swamp. The real issues are in the area of quantum physics for, as he discovers, that is the science of absolutely everything.(n)

programme.title: Is Anybody Out There
programme.desc: A run-down of developments in the search for extraterrestrial intelligence, exploring the theory that life was `seeded' on Earth by asteroid impacts in the remote past, and speculating on the possibility of inhabited planets existing elsewhere in the universe. Nasa officials share their thoughts on whether Jupiter's moon Europa is capable of supporting micro-organisms, while more far-sighted scientists look beyond the solar system, stressing that space knows no boundaries - and neither do the possibilities it contains.(n)

programme.title: The Saturn V Story
programme.desc: Documentary following the `space race' of the 1960s, focusing on the USA's multi-billion dollar space program. Featuring Nasa footage, visual effects and interviews with Apollo scientists to construct a timeline of President Kennedy's 1961 pledge to put a man on the moon by the end of the decade, and the reality of 24 individuals successfully making the journey in the Saturn V rocket.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Solar Storms - The Threat to Planet Earth.
programme.desc: Scientists predict a fit of violent activity on the sun which will propel billions of tonnes of superheated gas and pulses of energy towards Earth. In 1989 one of these solar storms, which has the power to close down modern technology, cut off the power to the Canadian city of Quebec. Horizon meets the weathermen as they try to predict what is coming and organisations like the National Grid as they prepare for the cosmic tempest.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: What on Earth Is Wrong with Gravity?.

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: The Trouble with Space Junk.
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the scale of the problem of debris in space, with Earth surrounded by hundreds of millions of items moving at 17,000 miles per hour. The International Space Station had to move three times in 2014 to avoid potentially lethal chunks of junk and the Horizon team reveals how the US government is investing $1 billion to track space debris, while companies around the world are developing ways to clear up the mess, from nets and robot arms to harpoons.(n)

programme.title: Shuttle Discovery's Last Mission
programme.desc: A look at the final mission of Nasa's now retired third operational orbiter the Space Shuttle Discovery, which has spent more time in space than any other similar craft, flying in excess of 148 million miles. The programme focuses on its journey to the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, a technically challenging and emotional experience.(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: The Bride has an epic showdown with her former boss and lover in the over-the-top finale of Quentin Tarantino's stylized revenge saga(n)

programme.title: Bad Company
programme.desc: One of the CIA's finest agents is killed in Prague in the middle of an operation to stop East European terrorists. His identical twin brother, New York ticket scalper Jake Hayes, is recruited to complete the mission. But Jake isn't convinced that suits and guns are his thing. Espionage thriller with a comic edge(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: When two children find a mysterious old board game and start to play it, they release a mysterious man called Alan, who's closely followed by a horde of stampedimg animals! It seeems he and a friend discovered the game 25 years earlier, and he became trapped in it. Can the two kids tame the madcap menagerie and help Alan to escape from his supernatural prison? Great computer animated effects and some excellent perfromances make this a truly magical film that's fun for all the family(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: Ex-Playboy Bunny Shelley Darlingson causes campus chaos when she joins a sorority of geeky girls and helps them turn their love lives around(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Aspiring singer Roxie Hart longs for the limelight, and so does vampish nightclub sensation Velma Kelley. Both women end up on Death Row competing for headlines, aided in their efforts by hotshot attorney Billy Flynn(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: Uma Thurman stars as an assassin who seeks bloody revenge on those who left her for dead on her wedding day(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: The Bride has an epic showdown with her former boss and lover in the over-the-top finale of Quentin Tarantino's stylized revenge saga(n)

programme.title: Signs
programme.desc: Suspenseful story about a disillusioned ex-minister who discovers mysterious crop circles on his farm(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: Director Gore Verbinski and the crew set sail once again for this, the third chapter in the swashbuckling Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy. Captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) is hopelessly trapped in Davy Jones' locker after a harrowing encounter with the dreaded Kracken, and now Will Turner (Orlando Bloom) and Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) must align themselves with the nefarious Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) if they hold out any hope of saving their old friend from a fate worse than death. The East India Trading Company and its fearsome leader, Lord Cutler Beckett (Tom Hollander), have taken control of the ghostly Flying Dutchman and its captain, Davy Jones (Bill Nighy), and now the baleful Admiral Norrington (Jack Davenport) has taken the helm in a relentless bid to destroy every pirate ship in his path and bring the Age of Piracy to a violent close. Meanwhile, Will, Elizabeth, and Captain Barbossa navigate treacherous waters and face bitter betrayal as they set sail to gather the only army that can stand up to Beckett -- The Nine Lords of the Brethren Court. But Captain Jack Sparrow is one of the lords, and as long as he's stuck in Davy Jones' locker, Beckett and his nefarious armada are sure to emerge victorious. There's still hope, however, if the heroic team that includes Tia Dalma (Naomie Harris), Pintel (Lee Arenberg), and Ragetti (Mackenzie Crook) can reach exotic Singapore and convince vulpine pirate Sao Feng (Chow Yun-Fat) to provide them with charts and a ship. But even the powerful Brethren Court may need a bit of help from volatile sea goddess Calypso in order to weather the coming storm. With the entire future of the pirate way at stake, everyone will be forced to choose sides while drifting precariously to the edge of the earth for one final, spectacular battle(n)

programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Part 1. Part 1 of 3. A McCoy is murdered by a Hatfield and a forbidden love affair begins at the start of the legendary Hatfield-McCoy family feud, which nearly brought the states of Kentucky and West Virginia to civil war in the 1880s(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: Ex-Playboy Bunny Shelley Darlingson causes campus chaos when she joins a sorority of geeky girls and helps them turn their love lives around(n)

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: An interracial couple moves into their California dream home, only to find themselves the target of their volatile next-door neighbor -- a racist LAPD officer -- in this tightly wound thriller starring Samuel L. Jackson and Kerry Washington. Newlyweds Chris and Lisa seem like they have the perfect marriage and now, with their new home in the exclusive community Lakeview Terrace, the perfect life as well, but things soon turn ugly in the posh neighborhood when they begin to receive threats from their neighbor Abel, a middle-aged LAPD officer who has obvious objections to the couple's interracial marriage. What starts as an attitude problem soon morphs into full-on harassment, and before long the couple finds that their worries go far beyond their property values -- or the encroaching California wildfire burning in view of their community -- as they begin to fear for their lives(n)

programme.title: I Spit on Your Grave 2
programme.desc: A young model survives a brutal gang rape in New York City, and seeks bloody vengeance on her attackers in this sequel to 2010's I Spit on Your Grave. Katie (Jemma Dellender) was a small town model with big city dreams when she arrived in the Big Apple determined to launch her career. Spotting a flyer that tempts her with a free photo shoot, Katie takes the number and makes the call. But when the cameras stop flashing, the nightmare begins. Abducted, tortured, raped, and left for dead, Katie should never have survived the atrocities committed against her. Yet she did, and now as her attackers gasp for their last precious breaths while staring into her cold vengeful eyes, they will finally know the true meaning of fear(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Two middle-aged goof-offs become members of the same family when one's mother marries the other's father, and sparks soon start to fly between the contentious new step-siblings(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion returns for a rematch with Apollo Creed, hoping, finally, to capture the heavyweight title. This time, even his girlfriend, Adrian, gives Rocky her blessing(n)

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Mike Myers and Dana Carvey star as Wayne Campbell and Garth Agar, lifelong friends who present their own cult cable show, Wayne's World, from a basement. Such is their success, slimy TV executive Ben Oliver plans to buy their show and turn it into a product-placement special. And to complicate matters, both Wayne and Oliver have fallen for foxy singer Cassandra. Based on characters first seen on Saturday Night Live, Myers' script and Penelope Spheeris's direction created an unlikely comedy, in which the nerds inherited the earth and a host of catchphrases were born. Excellent(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: Director Gore Verbinski and the crew set sail once again for this, the third chapter in the swashbuckling Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy. Captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) is hopelessly trapped in Davy Jones' locker after a harrowing encounter with the dreaded Kracken, and now Will Turner (Orlando Bloom) and Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) must align themselves with the nefarious Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) if they hold out any hope of saving their old friend from a fate worse than death. The East India Trading Company and its fearsome leader, Lord Cutler Beckett (Tom Hollander), have taken control of the ghostly Flying Dutchman and its captain, Davy Jones (Bill Nighy), and now the baleful Admiral Norrington (Jack Davenport) has taken the helm in a relentless bid to destroy every pirate ship in his path and bring the Age of Piracy to a violent close. Meanwhile, Will, Elizabeth, and Captain Barbossa navigate treacherous waters and face bitter betrayal as they set sail to gather the only army that can stand up to Beckett -- The Nine Lords of the Brethren Court. But Captain Jack Sparrow is one of the lords, and as long as he's stuck in Davy Jones' locker, Beckett and his nefarious armada are sure to emerge victorious. There's still hope, however, if the heroic team that includes Tia Dalma (Naomie Harris), Pintel (Lee Arenberg), and Ragetti (Mackenzie Crook) can reach exotic Singapore and convince vulpine pirate Sao Feng (Chow Yun-Fat) to provide them with charts and a ship. But even the powerful Brethren Court may need a bit of help from volatile sea goddess Calypso in order to weather the coming storm. With the entire future of the pirate way at stake, everyone will be forced to choose sides while drifting precariously to the edge of the earth for one final, spectacular battle(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: A wild and star-studded parody of 'Star Wars', in which the fair Princess Vespa must be rescued from the malevolent clutches of arch-villain Lord Dark Helmet, giving rise to a series of heroic escapades(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Two middle-aged goof-offs become members of the same family when one's mother marries the other's father, and sparks soon start to fly between the contentious new step-siblings(n)

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Mike Myers and Dana Carvey star as Wayne Campbell and Garth Agar, lifelong friends who present their own cult cable show, Wayne's World, from a basement. Such is their success, slimy TV executive Ben Oliver plans to buy their show and turn it into a product-placement special. And to complicate matters, both Wayne and Oliver have fallen for foxy singer Cassandra. Based on characters first seen on Saturday Night Live, Myers' script and Penelope Spheeris's direction created an unlikely comedy, in which the nerds inherited the earth and a host of catchphrases were born. Excellent(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion returns for a rematch with Apollo Creed, hoping, finally, to capture the heavyweight title. This time, even his girlfriend, Adrian, gives Rocky her blessing(n)

programme.title: Kickboxer
programme.desc: A fighter battles the Thai champ who injured his brother(n)

programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 3. The Hatfields seek revenge after one of theirs is murdered by a McCoy. When friends and neighbors join the fighting, West Virginia and Kentucky are brought to the brink of civil war(n)

programme.title: Way of The Dragon
programme.desc: Martial-arts mayhem with Bruce Lee taking on mobsters in Rome. Chuck Norris, Nora Miao. Wang: Huang Chung Hsun. Ah K'ung: Chin Ti. Boss: Jon T. Benn. Robert: Robert Wall. Lee also directed(n)

programme.title: Death Wish
programme.desc: Paul Kersey, New York Archtitect, is a bleeding-heart liberal whose world is suddenly torn apart by the murder of his wife and the rape of his daughter. After a vacation to Arizona, Kersey returns to New York with a vengeance against crime, and takes to vigilantism(n)

programme.title: The Company
programme.desc: Night 1. The dawn of the CIA is chronicled via the experiences of three college grads---including the idealistic Jack McAuliffe (Chris O'Donnell)---who are recruited as spies and drawn into shadowy Cold War espionage. Jack is mentored by a master spy (Alfred Molina), and the two set out to unmask a mole within the ranks. Jack also develops an unhealthy attraction to a fetching spy (Alexandra Maria Lara). Michael Keaton also stars. Executive produced by brother filmmakers Tony and Ridley Scott(n)

programme.title: The Company
programme.desc: Night 2. In the late 1950s, Jack (Chris O'Donnell) journeys to Hungary to assist an uprising against the Soviets. But when the strengthening Soviets fight back, Jack is imprisoned, along with an Englishwoman (Natascha McElhone). Later, Jack becomes entangled in the Bay of Pigs debacle. Meanwhile, an intelligence expert (Michael Keaton) grows overly consumed with unmasking a CIA mole. Executive produced by Tony and Ridley Scott(n)

programme.title: The Company
programme.desc: Night 3. Angleton (Michael Keaton) pushes ahead to unmask a mole within the CIA ranks, obtaining inside information from a Russian defector. His prime suspect: a high-ranking leader in the CIA. Meanwhile, KGB master spy Starik (Ulrich Thomsen) attempts to launch his final plan to defeat the U.S. Jack: Chris O'Donnell(n)

programme.title: The Island
programme.desc: Adventure thriller about a reporter who is investigating the story behind a series of disappearances in the Caribbean when he is captured by a lost tribe of pirates. The villains, who have been looting and pillaging in the region since the 18th century, need a new leader and seem to think one of their captives is a good prospect. Based on a novel by Peter Benchley(n)

programme.title: Down Missouri Way
programme.desc: Hectic times in the Ozarks when a movie company arrives to shoot location scenes. Martha O'Driscoll. Mortimer: Eddie Dean. Dunning: John Carradine. Mike: William Wright. Cindy: Mabel Todd. Gloria: Renee Godfrey. Pappy: Roscoe Ates. Mild amusement(n)

programme.title: Super Capers
programme.desc: A wannabe superhero joins a team of bumbling heroes-in-training on a time-traveling mission to thwart an evil plot in this high-flying comedy featuring Clint Howard, Adam West, Tom Sizemore, and Doug Jones. Ed Gruberman (Justin Whalin) may not possess any actual superpowers, but his passion for fighting crime rivals that of even the greatest comic-book do-gooders. When Ed becomes a member of The Super Capers, an oddball team of aspiring superheroes, it seems as if his dream of fighting crime for real is about to come true. Upon discovering evidence of an evil plot involving gold bullion, an alluring femme fatale, and a powerful criminal mastermind, Ed travels back in time to prevent a disaster the likes of which the world has never seen(n)

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: A stylish period thriller in which a gentleman crook and a master safe-cracker attempt the first moving train robbery - their target a British Army payroll on its way to the Crimean War(n)

Based on an idea by Steve Martin, the film is written and directed by Day After Tomorrow screenwriter Jeffrey Nachmanoff(n)

programme.title: Equilibrium
programme.desc: Following a cataclysmic world war, the leading world powers outlaw emotion, believing that doing so will reduce the chances of another conflict. Thought-police known as Clerics are sent to enforce the law and put offenders to death. When one Cleric accidentally misses a dose of the drug which suppresses his emotions, he begins to reconsider his role in the fight against expression(n)

programme.title: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
programme.desc: A surreal crime drama told as only Jim Jarmusch could, Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai stars Forest Whitaker as Ghost Dog, a hit man living in an unidentified but run-down city in what license plates call "The Industrialized State." Known for his gift of being able to come and go without people noticing him, Ghost Dog is a self-taught samurai who is obsessed with order and his strict personal moral code, drawn from the philosophies of the Japanese warriors. As every samurai needs a leader to whom he swears loyalty, Ghost Dog has devoted himself the service of Louie (John Tormey), a low-level crime boss who once saved his life. When Louie's superiors decide he must be executed, Ghost Dog leaps into action, methodically wiping out his many enemies. Along with a dizzying series of stylized shoot-outs, Ghost Dog also features carrier pigeons, characters who read Rashomon, a French-speaking ice cream man, and a score by RZA from the top-selling hip-hop group Wu-Tang Clan, who have their own well-documented obsession with Asian culture. Ghost Dog was screened in competition at the 1999 Cannes Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Forced to make a nerve-racking cross-country flight with Sharona, a nervous Adrian whiles away the anxiety of the journey by studying his fellow passengers - and soon concludes that the Frenchman sitting across the aisle has just murdered his wife. Tony Shalhoub stars, with a guest appearance by his wife Brooke Adams.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A child molester Lisbon caught and convicted in San Francisco is found shot dead near CBI headquarters in Sacramento, but when the gun is found to have her prints on it, she is accused of the murder. Unable to remember the night of the crime, she tries to prove her innocence by undergoing a polygraph test - which she fails, leaving her no choice but to ask Jane for help. Drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and Lisbon investigate the death of a biker gang's lawyer, who they suspect was murdered because he knew too many of the members' secrets. However, another lead is uncovered when they meet a woman who held a grudge against him because he successfully defended her brother's alleged murderer in court. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team targets a criminal who has been blackmailing businessmen into committing crimes, but Nate receives a surprise when he discovers his father is responsible.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nate and the team infiltrate the coal mines of West Virginia in the wake of a deadly explosion, hoping to pin the blame on the site's corrupt owner Dan Blackwell. However, their investigations threaten not just their target, but also the livelihoods of everyone in the tight-knit community. Guest starring Bruce Davison.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: An architect is found dead at his mansion by a police officer who claims a ghost could have had some involvement in the murder. The team investigates conventional leads, while Jane concentrates on pursuing the supernatural angle, discovering there is rumoured to be treasure hidden in the building. Elsewhere, Rigsby confesses his true feelings to Grace. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker, Owain Yeoman and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Bosco arrests Jane after discovering the bug in his office, leaving Cho and the other agents to investigate a murder case. They believe the victim was killed in a dispute over oil-rich land, and when they hand evidence over to Patrick he comes up with leads from the confines of his cell - before setting into motion an elaborate escape plan. Guest starring Ashley Jones (True Blood), with Simon Baker and Terry Kinney.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The vigilante crooks take time out from their hectic lives to share tales of glory from a time before they joined forces. As they compare notes, they begin to realise they each tried to steal the same rare artefact five years earlier - unaware they were competing against their future team-mates in the race to secure the item.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team discovers an antiquities trafficker working for Moreau is using refugee children as mules to smuggle artifacts, and travels to London to lure him into an auction house scam. While there, Sophie faces the consequences of her past actions. Guest starring James Frain (True Blood).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan.(n)

programme.sub-title: Stan Smith is Keanu Reeves as Stanny Utah in Point Breakers.
programme.desc: Stan hopes a beach-based assignment infiltrating a group of renegade surfers will be good for his dangerously high blood pressure. Meanwhile, Jeff and Haley have a pregnancy scare, Steve befriends a homeless drifter, and Roger tries to persuade Fifa to host the next World Cup in the Smiths' back yard. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.desc: Joe is injured when Peter, Cleveland, and Quagmire decide to run with the bulls, while Brian sleeps with a woman who is married to a Navy Seal.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter helps Joe to publish a book, but things get out of hand when he starts to take on the writing as well. Elsewhere, Brian begins an extreme exercise regime after experiencing a runner's high for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Cleveland returns to Quahog, but he and Peter are not allowed to spend time together after Lois and Donna get into a big fight over their parenting styles.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris interrupt Stewie's TV time, prompting the angry baby to go back in time to break up Peter and Lois so he's never conceived. However, he is instead reborn into a Downton Abbey-esque British household.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan thinks his chances of promotion are over when Hayley disrupts the CIA family carnival. However, when he pays Director Bullock a home visit to apologise, he discovers his badly behaved daughter is the boss's new girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes personal responsibility for Steve's sex education - but his advice is taken much too literally. Meanwhile, Roger gets a job as a barman in the hope of bettering himself. Animation, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Everyone loves the new Jeff when he suddenly turns up at the Smith house, but it soon becomes obvious it is actually an alien imposter with a devious mission.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Chinese businessman Fung Wah buys the American Dad TV show, while Stan commits Francine to an insane asylum when he forgets their anniversary.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Jerome tries to prevent his daughter Pam from dating Chris, but when the loved-up pair run away together he must unite with Peter to track them down. Animation, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg has fun partying with Peter when he takes her to a college for an interview, and Brian has to learn how to live in the wild after being sprayed by a skunk and forbidden from entering the house.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine decides to hold a party to get to know her neighbours, but Stan becomes suspicious of an Iranian couple. In an attempt to find evidence to support his hunch, he breaks into their house and is thrown into jail. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger cause a power failure, sparking fears of a terrorist attack.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The church deacon chokes on a communion wafer, prompting Stan to pull out all the stops in a bid to replace him. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Bosco and Lisbon reluctantly team up to investigate the kidnapping of a woman from a wealthy family. They suspect her abductors could have been behind a previous case in which a man was murdered, prompting Jane to take an unorthodox approach to save the victim's life before the ransom is paid. Crime drama, starring Terry Kinney, Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team are shocked to discover serial killer Red John targeted the CBI headquarters while they were out on assignment, leaving two agents dead and seriously wounding Bosco. Jane soon uncovers a link to another case, which leads him to vital evidence in the investigation - and the discovery that the criminal had an accomplice in the office. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The con-artists try to trick a bad-tempered hedge fund manager into believing he has killed Parker, as part of an elaborate scheme to get him to reveal critical information about Damian Moreau. Crime drama, starring Beth Riesgraf.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The con-artists take part in a festive-themed job, aiming to restore Father Chrismas's reputation by breaking into a mall and posing as St Nicholas himself. Eliot is forced to don the iconic red suit, while Hardison and Parker stand by as his assistants. However, the plot thickens when the team uncovers a nefarious scheme cooked up by an old rival. Guest starring Dave Foley and Wil Wheaton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Whacking Day. Principal Skinner (voice of Harry Shearer) ought to be used to misbehavior from Bart Simpson (voice of Nancy Cartwright) by now, but when Bart escapes from the school's basement after being locked-in to avoid any unpleasantness during a visit by Superintendent Chalmers (voice of Hank Azaria) and manages to run over Chalmers with a lawn tractor, Skinner has had enough and expels Bart. Rather than allow him to sit around all day, Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) encourages her son to read Johnny Tremain, which Bart does after learning the title character is deformed in an accident. To the surprise of everyone, Bart turns into a budding history buff. Meanwhile, the curious Springfield custom of Whacking Day, in which the local spend one day each year beating snakes senseless, has drawn the ire of Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith), who is offended by the purposeless cruelty to animals. In an effort to help save the snakes from a grim fate, Lisa attempts to attract the serpents to the safety of the Simpson home with the help of her funky bass guitar and the voice of visiting soul icon Barry White. Bart, meanwhile, has done some research and reveals the startling truth behind the origins of Whacking Day. "Whacking Day" first aired on April 29, 1993(n)

programme.desc: Much Apu About Something. Sanjay turns over the Kwik-E-Mart to his son, Jay, who goes against tradition, modernizes the store and makes it a cool health-food market. Bart, who has given up pranking, is enlisted to return to his playful ways and bring down the new establishment(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe Baby Blues. Moe saves Maggie's life and becomes her new best friend, but an otherwise intrusive presence in the house(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Mother the Carjacker. Homer tries to help his fugitive mother Mona evade justice, but unwittingly delivers her into the hands of the police - who promptly put her on trial for sabotaging Mr Burns' germ warfare laboratory back in the 1960s. With the guest voice of Glenn Close(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Vision Quest. The gang get to work early in a bid to spend quality time together(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Sitting. Archer babysits AJ for a weekend(n)

programme.title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
programme.desc: An admiral takes charge of an experimental submarine just as the world is plunged into catastrophe. A belt of radiation surrounding the planet has ignited, threatening all life on Earth. The admiral believes he can end the crisis with a well-aimed nuclear missile, but faces an uphill struggle to convince high command that his plan will not lead to more destruction. Sci-fi adventure, with Walter Pidgeon, Joan Fontaine and Robert Sterling.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Jack
programme.desc: A bumbling midshipman's uniform is stolen by a woman desperate to go to sea, who adopts his identity. Later, the hapless sailor is press-ganged on to the same ship as her. However, while trying to prove who he really is, he has to contend with mutinies, pirates and the Spanish Navy. Comedy, with Bernard Cribbins, Juliet Mills, Kenneth Williams and Charles Hawtrey.(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
programme.desc: A hapless youngster faces the daunting prospect of starting a new school year and desperately tries to impress a girl in his class. But as if that weren't enough to contend with, his parents also force him to spend more time with his bullying older brother. Children's comedy sequel, starring Zachary Gordon and Devon Bostick.(n)

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: A socially inept high-school student and his lonely unemployed brother find their eccentric home life thrown into upheaval when their meddling uncle comes to stay. The teenage oddball tries to make the best of his changing circumstances, while putting all his skills to the task of helping his new best friend win the class presidency. Comedy, starring Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez and Haylie Duff.(n)

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Children's adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci.(n)

programme.title: 2 Guns
programme.desc: Two undercover agents - one working for the DEA the other for the Navy - infiltrate a drug cartel, only for the planned sting operation to go disastrously wrong. Both operatives become fugitives and must work together to survive - but both keep their true identity a secret, mistakenly thinking the other is a real criminal. Action adventure, starring Denzel Washington and Mark Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Instinct
programme.desc: A prison psychologist probes the mind of a maximum-security inmate, an expert on primate behaviour, to find out what made the zoologist go berserk and murder two park rangers in Rwanda. Drama, inspired by Daniel Quinn's novel Ishmael, starring Anthony Hopkins, Cuba Gooding Jr, Donald Sutherland, George Dzundza and Maura Tierney.(n)

programme.title: Ruby Sparks
programme.desc: An author struggling with his second novel writes about his dream woman, only to find he has somehow willed her into existence. They begin a relationship, but he discovers he can influence what she does by writing about her, and gives in to the temptation to manipulate her behaviour to suit his needs. Fantasy drama, starring Paul Dano, Zoe Kazan and Annette Bening.(n)

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: A survivor of a near-extinct race is given a dangerous quest as his world approaches an astronomical event that will decide its future. He must find a way to restore a broken piece to a magical crystal, which has become a source of dark power for the cruel creatures who wiped out his people. Jim Henson's puppet fantasy, with the voices of Stephen Garlick and Billie Whitelaw.(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days
programme.desc: Weedy youngster Greg finds his plans for a lazy school holiday ruined when his mother bans video games and his father organises a series of family activities. When he finds out a girl he likes is working at a country club, he tells his family he has a summer job there as an excuse to spend time with her - but struggles to keep up the deception. Family comedy sequel, starring Zachary Gordon and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Millions
programme.desc: A bag of stolen money falls from the sky, and wide-eyed youngster Damian thinks it is a gift from God. However, his level-headed brother realises they must race against time to spend the loot before the country switches to the Euro and a robber on their tail catches up with them. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: A teenager falls in love with a new girl in his school, only to discover she is a witch. As dark secrets from her family's past emerge, they discover that on her 16th birthday, she will be required to choose a side in a conflict between good and evil. Fantasy based on Kami Garcia's novel, starring Alden Ehrenreich, Alice Englert, Jeremy Irons and Emma Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Predestination
programme.desc: A time travelling secret agent journeys back and forth through history in search of a bomber who has eluded him throughout his career. His final assignment requires him to finally apprehend the criminal, while also ensuring that his own past takes place as he remembers. Sci-fi thriller based on a short story by Robert Heinlein, starring Ethan Hawke, Sarah Snook and Noah Taylor.(n)

programme.title: It Follows
programme.desc: A university student discovers her boyfriend has passed a curse onto her after they sleep together for the first time. It results in her being stalked by a supernatural menace that always seems to be one step behind. Can she and her friends find a way to get rid of it before it finally catches up with her? Horror, starring Maika Monroe, Keir Gilchrist and Olivia Luccardi.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten focuses on egg recipes and reveals the secrets of omelettes, souffle and hollandaise.(n)

programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson heads to a baby shower she is hosting, with appetisers and desserts including goat's cheese truffles, cornbread muffins with baby shrimp salad, and baby cherry pies.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares food with herbs, including lemon-rosemary scones, French onion soup with fresh thyme, a panzanella salad with basil, and a minty raita with salted naan wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's bakes a caramel apple pie and a frozen grasshopper pie, as well as strawberry pretzel pie and mini blueberry galettes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares sides for the Thanksgiving feast, including broccoli wild rice casserole, sweet 'taters, and dressing with Brussels sprouts.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.desc: Ree Drummond turns her attention to desserts, including marshmallow pops for a sleepover treat and lime and coconut butter cookies for her step-mother.(n)

programme.desc: Ree is having a night on the town with Ladd, so she's prepping dinner for the kids in advance, making mini meatballs pasta bake and a mixed berry shortcake for dessert.(n)

programme.desc: Ree's family is throwing a joint birthday bash, so she's cooking up spicy pulled pork sliders, make-ahead slow cooker baked beans and a three-layer confetti cake for dessert.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Drummond is outraged when he is replaced by a woman, and Piglet is determined to see him reinstated.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin gets trapped between the joists in a loft while spending a weekend in a country cottage - and is eventually obliged to call Paul to his rescue. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: As George prepares to celebrate his 327th birthday the lease on his earthly body expires, causing him to age rapidly. A new member of staff at the health centre causes problems for Janet and Mrs Raven by deciding to modernise the surgery with Robbie Williams posters and hip-hop music. Ardal O'Hanlon stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The crew prepares for the millennium dinner at the Old Brewery and it is a race against time to get things organised. Tony makes a discovery on the fire escape that puts a damper on the festivities.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?.
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan decides she wants to get a dog, but her penchant for pooches creates plenty of trouble for Ben. Comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: As George prepares to celebrate his 327th birthday the lease on his earthly body expires, causing him to age rapidly. A new member of staff at the health centre causes problems for Janet and Mrs Raven by deciding to modernise the surgery with Robbie Williams posters and hip-hop music. Ardal O'Hanlon stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time.
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan decides she wants to get a dog, but her penchant for pooches creates plenty of trouble for Ben. Comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Shazia is looking forward to having fun with her friends as the day of her hen party arrives, only for a few unwelcome guests to tag along - and she ends up being bombarded with everyone's stories of married life. Meanwhile, Amjad has his stag do, which is being organised by his future father-in-law Mr Khan, so surely nothing can go wrong. Back at the house, the groom is put in a compromising position - and when the two parties collide, the wedding is left hanging in the balance. Kate Robbins guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Sketches include the Fat Sweaty Coppers, Unlucky Alf, Arthur Atkinson and Bob Fleming the coughing TV sensation.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: The object of Mark's desire, Dobby, goes out with a graphic designer, leaving him no choice but to form a club with Gerrard devoted to winning her over. Elsewhere, Zahra's boyfriend Ben, now back from hospital, offers Jeremy the job as head of development for his music website, but things take a turn for the worse when he signs up Super Hans's band Man Feelings. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Grand Theatre in Swansea, South Wales. Sean Lock heads the showcase of stand-ups from the comedy circuit, with support from Steve Williams, Ava Vidal and Alun Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: The Full Monty
programme.desc: Six unemployed men from Sheffield decide to become strippers for one night only in a bid to raise extra money. However, with no dancing experience and far from perfect physiques, the men rely on the unique selling point of complete nudity to impress the punters. Comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Tom Wilkinson, Hugo Speer and Paul Barber.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: The comedy duo pay tongue-in-cheek tribute to Fleetwood Mac, discuss Jerry Hall and star in a parody of In Bed with Madonna.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Dawn and Jennifer introduces sketches about sanitary protection and pony love, and star in a parody of Aliens. Guest starring Kathy Burke.(n)

programme.desc: Dave grows a goatee beard and the Royles throw a party to celebrate baby David's christening. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson and Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of recipes for a romantic dinner, including spicy squid salad, pan-fried chicken with mango salsa, and a chocolate mousse cake. Rachel also visits the English market in Cork, and a group of school-run mothers try one of her recipes.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The TV chef provides recipes for chicken noodle soup, fast prawn red curry, and cardamom and coconut panna cotta. The local lifeboat crew also tests out a dish while Rachel meets her favourite chicken farmer.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: After 10 weeks of stiff competition, calm finally descends on the Bake Off tent as judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry take up the reins to demonstrate how they would have tackled the contest's signature, technical and showstopper challenges had the roles been reversed. They begin with tasks from the first two weeks of the series, with Paul making a blackcurrant and liquorice Swiss roll and two types of savoury biscuits, while Mary prepares a cherry cake with lemon icing, Florentines and miniature classic coffee and walnut cakes.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The week's second heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a plate of food that showcases their culinary skills, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four try to impress Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace by preparing a dish featuring whelks and winkles, after which Marcus Wareing asks them to make a spectacular chocolate dessert. Marcus and Monica then decide which three have earned a place in the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of Si King and Dave Myers' European baking tour takes them to France. Travelling from Lyon to Carcassonne, they learn the secrets of teeth-pulling nougat, go truffle hunting and meet up with Dave's old flatmate, whom he has not seen for 30 years. Culinary delights en route include tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson begins with her take on a classic yoghurt pot cake, which was inspired by a scribbled note she found in an old Italian kitchen. The food writer's niece and nephew are recruited to make - and enjoy - a sausage meatball supper, while a girls' night in sees her rustling up squid and prawns with marjoram and chilli. The show ends with Nigella's `tiramisini' - a lighter, quicker version of a traditional tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares a Sunday lunch of slow-roasted shoulder pork, mackerel salad and her take on the traditional trifle. She also learns how to smoke her own fish in a biscuit tin.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes fit for summer, including quesadillas, seared steak salad and salmon with tomato and basil. She also meets the country's only buffalo mozzarella producer, and the ladies of the Irish Countrywomen's Association try one of Rachel's recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry tackle the challenges that they set the bakers during the bread and desserts weeks of the fifth series of The Great British Bake Off. Paul gives step-by-step instructions on how to prepare ciabatta, a Roquefort and walnut loaf, and chocolate volcano fondant puddings, while Mary demonstrates how to make her layered tiramisu cake and a flamboyant Neapolitan baked Alaska.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the third quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reach Spain on the final leg of their journey in search of Europe's finest baking. Travelling across the northern part of the country, they begin in St Sebastian, sampling delicacies including goose barnacles and pinchos - large tapas - and visiting a Basque dining club. Moving on, the duo bake dishes such as the Spanish bread pan rustico and a seafood empanada packed with locally caught fish. They also make a giant spelt sausage roll filled with chorizo, and join in with an ancient pagan ceremony in Galicia, before heading to Santiago de Compostela, where they end their 5,000-mile journey at a spectacular firework display to celebrate the 800th anniversary of St James. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: A pared-down approach to cuisine in which the domestic goddess reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. Nigella prepares her avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and `chicksalad' and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson treats her supper guests to a feast of lamb chops with mint, chilli and potatoes, served alongside roasted red onions with fennel and basil. Dessert is a true Anglo-Italian affair with a plum and amaretti crumble. There are also recipes for farro risotto with mushrooms, and chocolate pasta with a dark butterscotch sauce.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall gets preparations for the strawberry fete under way with his gardeners, planting seeds in every available place to ensure large crop yields. The chef spends an evening fishing for river trout as he gathers ideas for what to serve his guests, and apprentice Sarah Bilson is challenged to prepare the perfect sweet scone to earn her place in the baking team.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry tackle the challenges that they set the bakers during the bread and desserts weeks of the fifth series of The Great British Bake Off. Paul gives step-by-step instructions on how to prepare ciabatta, a Roquefort and walnut loaf, and chocolate volcano fondant puddings, while Mary demonstrates how to make her layered tiramisu cake and a flamboyant Neapolitan baked Alaska.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the third quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reach Spain on the final leg of their journey in search of Europe's finest baking. Travelling across the northern part of the country, they begin in St Sebastian, sampling delicacies including goose barnacles and pinchos - large tapas - and visiting a Basque dining club. Moving on, the duo bake dishes such as the Spanish bread pan rustico and a seafood empanada packed with locally caught fish. They also make a giant spelt sausage roll filled with chorizo, and join in with an ancient pagan ceremony in Galicia, before heading to Santiago de Compostela, where they end their 5,000-mile journey at a spectacular firework display to celebrate the 800th anniversary of St James. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: John Travolta gives a charming performance in this comic fantasy. Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael (Travolta) is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid writers, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love. Andie MacDowell, William Hurt, Bob Hoskins. Directed by Nora Ephron(n)

Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: Larry Kramer in Love and Anger
programme.desc: A profile of Larry Kramer, a dedicated activist and controversial writer who helped raise awareness of the AIDS crisis in the 1980s and change the way the U.S. government and the medical community responded to it after years of inaction(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 05/23/2017. Segments include a report on abuse in youth soccer programs in England; a profile of the Dodgers' Spanish broadcaster Jaime Jarrin; and a visit with Robert Gagno, the autistic defending winner of the World Pinball Championships(n)

programme.title: Magic & Bird: A Courtship of Rivals
programme.desc: The rivalry and friendship between NBA Hall of Famers Larry Bird and Magic Johnson is the focus of this documentary. Included: clips from their college and NBA battles; and interviews with coaches and teammates, including Pat Riley, Kevin McHale and Michael Cooper(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Customer Service. A hunt for financial support takes Richard outside the tech bubble, where he encounters a contentious figure from Pied Piper's past(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Blurb. Selina works on her book as her staff prepare for the ceremony to unveil her portrait. Meanwhile, Jonah tries to weasel his way onto the guest list; and Dan struggles to solve his on-screen chemistry problem(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal stars in this action-packed caper as a devoted soldier who leaves the military after his top-secret project is sabotaged. He teams up with a scientist to create a superpowered suit of steel to help battle crime after he learns that his special weapons are being used on the streets(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The youngest child of the family often has the most problems -- so why should things be different for the Prince of Darkness and his offspring? Satan (Harvey Keitel) is considering retirement, and is pondering which of his sons should take over the family business -- ambitious Adrian (Rhys Ifans), strapping Cassius (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.), or Nicky (Adam Sandler), an accident-prone demon who prefers to stay in his room playing his favorite heavy metal tunes. When Satan decides to stay on for another 10,000 years, Adrian is outraged, and leaves Hell to go to New York, where he and Cassius attempt to round up enough souls to vote Satan out of power. Satan, understandably upset, sends Nicky to bring Adrian and Cassius back home, but Nicky finds life on Earth is more complicated than he expected. Things don't get any easier when he develops a crush on Valerie (Patricia Arquette), a good-hearted mortal woman. Little Nicky also features Michael McKean as a city official trying to put Nicky behind bars, Kevin Nealon as Hell's gatekeeper, Rodney Dangerfield as Satan's father, Robert Smigel as the voice of Beefy -- a talking dog who is Nicky's guide on earth, Allen Covert as Todd -- Nicky's new roommate, and Peter Dante and Jonathan Loughran as a pair of metalheads who dig Satan. Jon Lovitz and Reese Witherspoon play cameo roles, and Regis Philbin and Ozzy Osbourne appear as themselves(n)
