programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Boris Epshteyn; Neil deGrasse Tyson; David Frum; Cornel West
programme.desc: Boris Epshteyn; Neil deGrasse Tyson; David Frum; Cornel West. Political strategist Boris Epshteyn and astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson are the interview guests. The panelists are Atlantic editor David Frum and scholar Cornel West(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: The discovery of marital troubles in her well-to-do Jewish family causes a young woman to question her own upcoming nuptials(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: John Travolta gives a charming performance in this comic fantasy. Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael (Travolta) is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid writers, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love. Andie MacDowell, William Hurt, Bob Hoskins. Directed by Nora Ephron(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale decide to let fate be their guide in this charming comedy about a man and woman who share an undeniable attraction when they meet, but concoct a series of experiments to determine if they are truly meant for each other. Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: Larry Kramer in Love and Anger
programme.desc: A profile of Larry Kramer, a dedicated activist and controversial writer who helped raise awareness of the AIDS crisis in the 1980s and change the way the U.S. government and the medical community responded to it after years of inaction(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Warning: This Drug May Kill You
programme.desc: A look at opioid addiction in the U.S. profiles four families whose lives have been decimated by drug abuse that began with legitimate prescriptions to dangerous painkillers that are often a gateway to heroin(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 142. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 05/23/2017. Segments include a report on abuse in youth soccer programs in England; a profile of the Dodgers' Spanish broadcaster Jaime Jarrin; and a visit with Robert Gagno, the autistic defending winner of the World Pinball Championships(n)

programme.title: Magic & Bird: A Courtship of Rivals
programme.desc: The rivalry and friendship between NBA Hall of Famers Larry Bird and Magic Johnson is the focus of this documentary. Included: clips from their college and NBA battles; and interviews with coaches and teammates, including Pat Riley, Kevin McHale and Michael Cooper(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Customer Service. A hunt for financial support takes Richard outside the tech bubble, where he encounters a contentious figure from Pied Piper's past(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal stars in this action-packed caper as a devoted soldier who leaves the military after his top-secret project is sabotaged. He teams up with a scientist to create a superpowered suit of steel to help battle crime after he learns that his special weapons are being used on the streets(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.desc: This epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

Great turns from everybody else in the huge and impressive cast(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A single father who has just found success as the host of an outrageous television talk show begins to question his path in life when he returns home to attend his parents' 50th wedding anniversary party in the company of his famous fiancée -- a reality television star -- in this crisis-of-conscience comedy(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Blurb. Selina works on her book as her staff prepare for the ceremony to unveil her portrait. Meanwhile, Jonah tries to weasel his way onto the guest list; and Dan struggles to solve his on-screen chemistry problem(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In desperate need of a vacation after being unceremoniously dumped by his TV-star girlfriend, a man travels to a lavish Hawaiian resort to nurse his wounds and forget his heartache, only to discover that his ex and her handsome new boyfriend are currently staying at the exact same island hot spot. Peter Bretter (Jason Segel) may be just another struggling musician, but for the past six years he's been dating Sarah Marshall (Kristen Bell), one of the hottest stars on television. Sarah is everything in the world to Peter, so when she kindly but firmly tells him that they should each go their separate ways, he is absolutely devastated. Later, after attempting to salvage his ego by awkwardly attempting to become a womanizer and nearly losing his job because of a nervous breakdown, an emotionally fragile Peter attempts to put the past behind him by escaping to the sun-soaked beaches of Oahu. While at first it seems as if Peter has discovered the perfect prescription for a bad case of lost love, his plan soon turns to dust when Sarah and her new rock-star boyfriend, Aldous (Russell Brand), turn up at the exact same resort. Though accepting Sarah's lavish new lifestyle won't be easy for the crestfallen Peter, the laid-back companionship of flirtatious resort employee Rachel (Mila Kunis) -- not to mention a continuous regimen of fruity cocktails -- goes a long way in mending the wounds of a broken heart. Forgetting Sarah Marshall was penned by Segel and produced by Judd Apatow. Fun with Dick and Jane screenwriter Nicholas Stoller makes his directorial debut. The cast also includes Paul Rudd, Bill Hader, Jack McBrayer, and Jonah Hill(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens a 14-year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past. Taken in by the intelligent and independent Boatwright sisters, Lily finds solace in their mesmerizing world of beekeeping(n)

programme.title: The Haunted Mansion
programme.desc: Workaholic estate agent Jim and his family become trapped in creepy Gracey Mansion as the ghostly owner needs them to lift an ancient curse(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: When a young man named Ethan falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, he discovers she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: MacArthur
programme.desc: Star Gregory Peck went into MacArthur disliking the title character that he was slated to play, but emerged from the experience with a deeper understanding and respect for this complex historical figure. The film is framed in flashback, with an octogenarian General Douglas MacArthur (Peck) making his final address before his alma mater of West Point. We flash back to the fall of Corregidor in 1942, with MacArthur promising "I shall return" to the beleaguered (and eventually imprisoned) American and Filipino troops. The story follows MacArthur's subsequent victories in the South Pacific, occasionally pausing to show us the General's omnipresent sense of "showmanship" (e.g. his wading ashore on the beaches of the Philippines for the benefit of the newsreel cameras). The greater part of the film involves MacArthur's attempts to restore dignity to the defeated postwar Japan, and to keep the Russian Communists from overtaking the orient as they had Eastern Europe. MacArthur is eventually fired from his post by President Truman after the general defies orders during the Korean conflict. MacArthur was intended as Universal's "answer" to 20th Century-Fox's enormously successful Patton (1970), but box-office returns were disappointing(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: The Quest
programme.desc: A petty criminal in 1920s New York City is enslaved by gun smugglers and sold to pirates who force him into the underworld of gambling and kickboxing. Jean-Claude Van Damme, Roger Moore, James Remar, Janet Gunn, Jack McGee, Louis Mandylor(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: Prehistory blockbuster from the director of Independence Day. An outcast mammoth-hunter embarks on an epic adventure after powerful invaders enslave his tribe. Setting out to rescue his kidnapped princess, he crosses uncharted realms, faces awesome monsters and forms an army to fight for liberation against the oppressive regime of an advanced civilisation similar to ancient Egypt(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A cop looking for a quieter way of life is thrown into the most dangerous crisis of his life in this thriller based on the novel by Robert Crais. Jeff Talley (Bruce Willis) used to be a hostage negotiator with the Los Angeles Police Department, but after a standoff goes horribly wrong, Talley moves himself and his family to a small, quiet town of Bristo Camino, where he serves as chief of police. When three young criminals attempt to steal a car from a wealthy accountant, the situation quickly spins out of control and the thieves are trapped inside the heavily fortified home, taking the accountant and his family hostage. The Ventura County Sheriff's Department soon arrives on the scene, and Talley eagerly hands over the situation to them, but when he unexpectedly finds himself in telephone contact with one of the children inside, he begins to suspect that the cops are in over their heads. After he's approached by a masked stranger who has an agenda of his own, Talley is forced to decide if he should protect the safety of the family in the house or his own wife and kids. Hostage was the first English-language film from director Florent Emilio Siri(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Part thriller, part fantasy, starring James Caviezel as a NYPD detective still torn apart by the death of his fire-fighter father Dennis Quaid. Fiddling with his dad's 'ham' radio, he suddenly finds he can contact his dad before his death and warns him of the danger. But the altered future sees Quaid's wife murdered and now son and father must try and solve the riddle of the murderer's identity and change the time line again in Gregory Hoblit's infinitely fascinating film(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Set amidst the burgeoning Seattle alternative music scene of the early '90s, Singles follows a group of twentysomethings as they try to find love and try to come to terms with their passage into adulthood. Arranged as an episodic comedy, the film follows a group of friends who live in the same apartment building and hang out at the same coffee shop. The central couple is Steve Dunne (Campbell Scott) and Linda Powell (Kyra Sedgwick), a pair who meet at an Alice In Chains concert and eventually fall in love. Singles follows the tumultuous relationship between Steve and Linda and their friendship with Janet Livermore (Bridget Fonda), who is trying to win the affection of grunge-rocker Cliff Poncier (Matt Dillon). The film also has a number of cameos, including actors Eric Stoltz, Tom Skerritt, Peter Horton, director Tim Burton and the film's author/director, Cameron Crowe. From the musical side of the fence, Singles features appearances by Sub Pop executive Bruce Pavitt, musicians Chris Cornell (Soundgarden), Pat DiNizio (Smithereens), Tad (Tad), and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder, Jeff Ament, and Stone Gossard, who play Dillon's backing band, Citizen Dick(n)

programme.desc: Mr. Monk Takes His Medicine. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. In the course of his investigation, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) gathers evidence which seems to indicate beyond doubt that Ricca was murdered by Sonny Chow himself. But this theory may not hold up in court: Sonny Chow has been dead for six years! Before this baffling case is solved, Monk has a too-close-for-comfort confrontation with the real killer, and ends up being buried alive--a grisly fate by anyone's standards, but especially so for a man with a crippling fear of both dirt and the dark(n)

programme.title: The Grey
programme.desc: A group of oil-rig workers must struggle with limited food and shelter when their plane crashes in remote Alaska(n)

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: Marcus Aquila is a Roman soldier determined to restore the tarnished reputation of his father, who 20 years earlier led his legion into the north of Roman-ruled Britain never to be seen again. Esca is a slave who harbors hatred for all things Roman. The two men ' master and slave ' venture beyond the edge of the known world on a dangerous and obsessive quest that will push them beyond the boundaries of loyalty and betrayal, friendship and hatred, deceit and heroism(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: After the runaway success of Jeepers Creepers in 2001, it was inevitable there would be a sequel, but this is just as smart and scary as the original. The Creeper has just two days of his allotted 23 on earth left to both eat his fill and replenish body parts that have decayed during his enforced years of hibernation. Fortunately, a broken-down bus full of college basketball players and their cheerleaders should provide for his needs. As the students are picked off one by one, their only hope is local farmer Jack Taggart, who's out to avenge his son's death. Victor Salva's film is satisfyingly full of edge-of-the-seat moments, not to mention the required quota of gruesome deaths and gore(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: Jeff and Amy Taylor (Kurt Russell and Kathleen Quinlan) are travelling cross country to California. When their Jeep breaks down, she accepts a lift from trucker J T Walsh to the nearest diner to call for help. But she fails to return and when Jeff eventually gets to the diner, no-one, including the trucker, has ever seen his wife... Jonathan Mostow's taut thriller shows a man trapped in a paranoid nightmare, trying to find his wife in the face of consistent denial of her very existence(n)

programme.title: Jennifer's Body
programme.desc: A newly possessed cheerleader turns into a killer who specialises in offing her male classmates. Can her best friend put an end to the horror?(n)

programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness continue to put their unique stamp on classic Hollywood films via star-studded remakes. This week, they turn their attention to the concluding instalment of the original Star Wars trilogy, Return of the Jedi. Former Coronation Street star Michelle Keegan fills in for Carrie Fisher as Princess Leia, while Ant and Dec follow in Warwick Davis's footsteps as Ewoks. Phillip Schofield waxes philosophical as the swamp-dwelling mystic Yoda, and David Dickinson shrouds himself in darkness as the evil Emperor. Keith himself becomes the heroic Luke Skywalker, while Paddy takes over from Harrison Ford as the smooth-talking space-rogue Han Solo.(n)

programme.desc: Peter is inspired by the writing of Stephen King and begins to imagine his friends appearing in three of the author's stories, with a journey of self-discovery in Stand By Me, Brian being rescued in Misery and a version of The Shawshank Redemption in which he and Cleveland become friends in prison.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got More Talent
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the companion show to the talent competition, going behind the scenes to uncover all the latest news, views and gossip from the programme, including backstage shenanigans and plenty of bonus audition footage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: I Am Peter, Hear Me Roar.
programme.desc: Peter is sent to a women's sensitivity retreat as punishment for telling a sexist joke, and gets in touch with his feminine side - much to the dismay of Lois, who enlists the help of Quagmire to return him to his old self. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois's wealthy aunt dies, leaving the Griffins her Rhode Island holiday home - but the family feels uneasy living in luxury. Peter takes lessons to become a debonair gentleman and ends up inadvertently giving away his new-found wealth. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike joins forces with Scotland Yard when a gang of thieves turns up in Aidensfield, apparently plotting to steal a valuable horse from local trainer Kieron Doyle. The heroic copper doggedly pursues his quarry to the detriment of his relationship with Tricia - but tragedy strikes, leaving him heartbroken.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Dick severely injures a boy in a car accident, filling him with guilt and remorse, while Peggy faces up to a painful problem of her own. Drama, starring Pam Ferris, Sarah Lancashire and William Travis.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The increasing elephant population presents Danny with a problem, but Mara's new owner Elliot Kriel offers a solution. Du Plessis is thrilled when his son Kirk brings news that his girlfriend Neema is pregnant, but his joy is short-lived when the couple announce their future plans - and the soon-to-be grandfather seeks solace in the bottle. A hen party of excitable young women, the first guests of the luxury lodge, proves invaluable when a group of rich, demanding bankers causes trouble. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.desc: Felix gets a job working for Mr Tremayne at the hotel, but when he finds a dinner service with a royal crest on it, he suspects his new employer of stealing it.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A racehorse trainer asks Holmes to investigate the mysterious disappearance of one of his cash-strapped employer's many creditors. Victorian whodunit, starring Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke, with a young Jude Law in an early supporting role.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A magistrate does his best to protect a young troublemaker - until an embarrassing connection between the two comes to light. The village mourns the death of Dr Summerbee, who is temporarily replaced by James Alway, while Vernon wonders if he may regret an offer to help old flame Maggie Byrne. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A student nurse causes quite a stir when she arrives in the middle of the night, while Ken and Alun contend with a farming family suffering a crisis. Brigid and Jill deliver a Down's syndrome baby whose parents don't want anything to do with it, and Lizzie's crash diet has alarming consequences. Starring Wendy Craig, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny is shocked when an old flame from veterinary college unexpectedly turns up with a tranquillised lioness, which she claims to have found in the Bush. Meanwhile, Du Plessis volunteers to purchase more prey animals for the newly merged reserve, but has an ulterior motive for attending the auction, and Sarah struggles to maintain order when she takes over Evan's class. Guest starring Maggie O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A woman arrives at the depot to claim her lost property, but Stan and Jack have already eaten it. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan gets a new uniform and is proud to wear it - until he sits on a freshly painted chair. Classic comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.desc: Ivy and Billy enter a competition to write an article about their profession, and learn that truth is stranger than fiction.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A friend of Jessica's wins a fortune in a sweepstake - but soon discovers her new-found wealth brings a host of problems in its wake, and realises she can trust no one. Starring Angela Lansbury and Loretta Swit.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the murder of her old friend Father Gorman, using a list of names sent by the priest moments before his death to bring the guilty party to justice. Following a trail of clues to London, Marple is drawn to the Pale Horse Inn - where she discovers a sinister world of occult practices. Drama, starring Julia McKenzie in the title role, with Lynda Baron, Pauline Collins, Nicholas Parsons and Neil Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspected kidnapping and gets his first lead when a ransom note is discovered. The missing woman then turns up dead at the wheel of a crashed car, smelling of alcohol. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: The Knock
programme.desc: Danson buries Noveski's body, while Diane and Andreotti receive a lead in their search for Dewhurst when the forger's accomplice comes forward. With Colin Baker and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Simon Tremayne reluctantly takes Hetty as his silent partner in the hotel to help make ends meet. Hetty thinks she can make money by holding a Valentine's dance; but treats the guests like children in her classroom. Things worsen when a health inspector almost closes the hotel down after finding a 100-year-old bird, dead, in the ice house. Arthur wants to dance with Felicity, but she has agreed to go to the dance with Gus.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A desperate girl contacts Holmes and asks him to clear her boyfriend of killing his father, a farmer found bludgeoned to death beside a lake. Period drama, starring Jeremy Brett , Peter Vaughan and James Purefoy.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy falls in love with the victim of a handbag snatch, and the unlikely pair become the talk of the village as they go out on a series of dates. Merton attempts to track down porcelain figures stolen during a crime spree in nearby Whitby - and is given a new lead when a similar theft occurs at Mr Osbourne's house.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes at the Royal v Ashfordly General rugby match, as Cheriton dives to score a try, only to be pounced on by opponents. It soon emerges that his injuries are serious, and Ormerod rushes to help his colleague - but his efforts prove futile and Cheriton dies at the scene. Meanwhile, Alun is involved in a road accident caused by a man who recently suffered a stroke, and student nurse Samantha Beaumont fails to impress Matron and Sister Brigid by putting pink sheets on the ward's beds. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Andy Wear, Stuart Wade, Anna Madeley, Wendy Craig and Linda Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: When Du Plessis discovers a rare white lion in the Bush, the residents of Leopard's Den resolve to keep its existence a secret. Rosie feels guilty about neglecting her relationship with Max to tend to an ailing rooikat, and Caroline enlists the girl's help to track down the poachers. Kriel's wife Amy (EastEnders star Jessie Wallace) arrives on the reserve.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan indulges a whim and lifts Doreen off the ground, but strains his back in the process. Classic comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack asks Arthur's sister out to the Boxing Day social - much to her brother's displeasure. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: In Loving Memory
programme.desc: Billy finds himself in deep water when he collects a client from the seaside.(n)

Merton attempts to track down porcelain figures stolen during a crime spree in nearby Whitby - and is given a new lead when a similar theft occurs at Mr Osbourne's house.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A local fisherman gets involved in shady dealings. When he goes on the run, Jessica finds herself mixed up with dodgy detective Charlie Garrett, who has arrived to investigate. Angela Lansbury stars, with Wayne Rogers, Matt Mulhern and William Windom.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeant's exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. The victim had been at odds with his peers over the fate of a potentially lucrative parcel of college-owned land, and the case is complicated by the appearance of DI Thursday's old gangland enemy - whom he must face alone while Endeavour makes a trip back to Lincolnshire to visit his ailing father.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Crooked property tycoon Ted Standen goes back on his word following the release from prison of his former business partner Alex Rowan. The vengeful ex-associate begins orchestrating attacks on Ted and his son John, and Terry is called upon to protect the youngster. Gareth Hunt and Alfie Bass guest star, with George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Old Man Richard appraises a set of punching bags once owned by heavyweight champ Rocky Marciano, while an old pocket watch catches Rick's eye.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: My Greatest Moment.
programme.desc: A selection of the greatest moments in the history of the Isle of Man TT. Presented by Craig Doyle, with Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the fifth day of the second Grand Slam tournament of the year at Roland Garros, where the second-round matches are scheduled to conclude. Top seeds Novak Djokovic and Serena Williams recorded straight-sets victories over Steve Darcis and Teliana Pereira respectively at this stage in 2016, but while Djokovic will be looking to emulate his triumph last year, Williams was not among the entries this year as she is expecting her first child. Rafael Nadal was also in top form as he dispatched Facundo Bagnis 6-3, 6-0, 6-3, but was forced to withdraw due to injury before his third-round match. This time around, he will be hoping to build on his second place in January's Australian Open, his best performance in a Grand Slam since 2013, and claim this title for a record 10th time. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: Preview Show.
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents a look ahead to the Isle of Man TT races that get under way on Saturday, meeting the leading contenders. With analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: TT Blues
programme.desc: The work of the Isle of Man Constabulary during the world famous TT races. Residents and officers work together to prepare the island for the TT fortnight. German cops Evald and Ralf arrive to give this small force a helping hand, while neighbourhood officers Kirsty Bowley and Stuart McLean unearth some drugs, and traffic cop Wayne Softley faces a tough challenge at a mountain crash. Meanwhile, clerk of the course Gary Thompson battles to get a race away on time.(n)

programme.title: Halloween H20
programme.desc: Homicidal madman Michael Myers returns to stalk his original target, now an alcoholic teacher, 20 years after his first killing spree, and ends up terrorising a group of teenagers in a deserted school. Horror sequel, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, Josh Hartnett and Michelle Williams.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale introduces coverage from the sixth day's play at Roland Garros, featuring the opening third-round singles matches in the men's and women's draws. After struggling through the first two rounds in five sets, Andy Murray produced an altogether more dominant display at this stage last year, beating Ivo Karlovic 6-1, 6-4, 7-6. Meanwhile, 2015 champion Stan Wawrinka was also in top form as he overcame Jeremy Chardy 6-4, 6-3, 7-5, and Richard Gasquet was a 6-2, 7-6, 6-2 victor over Nick Kyrgios. In the women's competition, eventual champion Garbine Muguruza comfortably defeated Yanina Wickmayer 6-3, 6-0, and second seed Agnieszka Radwanska prevailed 6-2, 6-7, 6-2 against Barbora Strycova. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: Qualifying Highlights.
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents qualifying action from the prestigious motorcycle event, held on a road course on the Isle of Man. Steve Parrish and Steve Plater analyse the form of the front runners as the countdown continues to Saturday's Superbike race.(n)

programme.title: TT Blues
programme.desc: Sunday mayhem leaves the road traffic cops stretched to the limit. A crash survivor opens up about his dice with death, and neighbourhood officers Stuart McLean and Steve Hall embrace the TT spirit in Douglas town. Meanwhile, Chief Constable Gary Roberts has an encounter with a flush of ducks, and heavy fog threatens the last 2016 TT race.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: A tough mobster pitches up at a lonely town on the Texan border during the Prohibition era, and spies an opportunity to cash in on the intense rivalry between warring Irish and Italian crime gangs by offering his services to both sides. Action adventure set in the 1930s, starring Bruce Willis, Christopher Walken and Alexandra Powers.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.sub-title: Robin of Sherwood to Prime Suspect.
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates this exploration of links from the new-age mysticism of Robin of Sherwood to the gritty realism of ITV drama series Prime Suspect.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Madeleine reluctantly begins re-examining her attitude to the Germans and Renard is arrested for an act of resistance, forcing him into a battle of wills with the secret police. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew's terminally ill mother asks him to help end her life, while back in Cardale, the past catches up with scheming locum Dr Nick Goodson, exposing his web of lies and deceit in spectacular fashion. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham, Adrian Lukis and Thomas Lockyer star.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Cade faces a dilemma after a child is killed by joyriders on a local estate.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: New clinical director Jack tries to curry favour with Christine by criticising Robert's management skills, while David's first day in surgery doesn't go as well as he'd hoped. Mike returns from London wanting his old job back, but walks straight into a fiery situation with Cathy, who's none too pleased to see him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike has problems when a man held in custody drops dead. Bernie and Greengrass establish a taxi firm and look for ways to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A mystery woman arranges a meeting with Maigret - and subsequently accuses him of trying to seduce her. Caught on the defensive, he suspects she's in the employ of the villain behind a series of restaurant robberies - but the truth proves far stranger. Michael Gambon stars.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: As the German persecution of the Jews begins, Renard uses the annual procession of St Josse to register his disgust at the events taking place. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw, Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill, Bernd-Uwe Reppenhagen, Geoffrey Hutchings and Des McAleer.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Clare begins to lose her grip on reality altogether, while David has an unscheduled run-in with glamorous old flame Anna Bradshaw, and it isn't long before sparks are flying again - in more ways than one. Adrian Lukis, Caroline Langrishe and Gary Mavers star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Eternal bachelor Greengrass falls in love with an aristocratic lady poacher, and an old flame of Mike's turns up out of the blue to complicate his life. Rural capers, starring Nick Berry, Natasha Dahlberg and Frances de la Tour.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Two deadly incidents of racial hatred, more than 20 years apart, cause problems for Chief Constable Alan Cade. Martin Shaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine grows closer to Jack as her professional relationship with Robert continues to deteriorate, but is under no illusions about what her boss wants from her. Mike realises there are plenty more fish in the sea and vows to have a good time playing the field, and Kate's moonlighting gets her into trouble. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook.
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Crime drama following the personal and professional lives of two detectives working for a Manchester police unit that specialises in murder cases. DC Janet Scott (Lesley Sharp) and DC Rachel Bailey (Suranne Jones) investigate the case of a pregnant woman who was killed in her bedroom. Meanwhile, Rachel's love life takes a turn for the worse and Janet gets a call that reawakens a past tragedy. Also starring Rupert Graves, Amelia Bullmore and Nicholas Gleaves.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet reopens the investigation into the murder of childhood friend Veronica, Rachel receives news that makes her personal life even more complicated, and a teenage murderer is successfully charged, but horrific events start to unravel following his arrest. Crime drama, guest starring Sally Lindsay (Coronation Street), with Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Homefront
programme.desc: Army wife-to-be Claire has found a job, but as she breezes through her month's trial things start to slip at home. She catches stepdaughter Millie in a compromising position with a squaddie from Pete's battalion and starts to question her future. Meanwhile, Paula commissions a portrait of Matt as a surprise for Howard, and Cheryl encourages Tasha to think about setting up her own business with the insurance payout.(n)

programme.title: Breathless
programme.desc: When Jean arrives at the hospital with a patient who wants a `private' procedure, Angela struggles to believe her sister is risking everything to assist with Otto's illegal activities. Still hurting from his new wife's betrayal about the miscarriage, Richard seeks out Margaret, a glamorous woman from his past, and he's keen to rekindle their romance. Meanwhile, Elizabeth arranges to meet Chief Inspector Mulligan in the hope of getting him off her case for good.(n)

programme.title: Band of Gold
programme.desc: The killer's identity is finally revealed. Meanwhile, Rose makes an unexpected return to Bradford and uses her new business skills to help the women steal a profitable cleaning contract from George. Carol's hopes of getting her daughter back are boosted by a visit from her social worker - but the arrival of a sinister gift sends her spirits plummeting as she realises the murderer has her in his sights. Cathy Tyson, Geraldine James and David Schofield star.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: An old friend of the detective contacts him when his girlfriend is murdered, but the pipe-smoking sleuth finds the woman had more than one lover. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.desc: The priest leads the townsfolk in a snub to the Germans, and Etienne incurs the Nazis' anger with a foolhardy and premature show of resistance. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.desc: Erica fears Andrew is getting too romantically involved with a doctor from a neighbouring surgery, and makes a surprise decision over his marriage proposal. However, while she's looking to the future, a dangerous legacy from the past is threatening public safety elsewhere in Cardale. Rural drama, starring Saskia Wickham and Gary Mavers.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman is admitted to hospital after a series of burglaries, and Nick and Jo start planning their life together. Greengrass and Bernie try their hand at modern art. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: The Self-Destruct Button. It's a toss-up as to who is more disgusted by the news that Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) has slept with Derek (Patrick Dempsey): Meredith's roomies Izzie (Katherine Heigl) and George (T.R. Knight), or the interns' granite-faced supervisor Bailey (Chandra Wilson). Back at Seattle Grace, Derek picks George to assist him during an extremely delicate brain operation, but George may lose the opportunity if he speaks up about the drinking problem of veteran anestheseologist Dr. Taylor. Elsewhere, Izzie performs emergency surgery on a disgruntled gent who has swallowed his girlfriend's car keys; Alex (Justin Chambers) meets a fellow former wrestler named Owens (Russell Hornsby), who has developed a morbid fascination with self-mutilation; and several of the interns become involved in the plight of a teenager who is suffering the aftereffects of a botched gastric bypass operation(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Save Me. Shepherd's tight-lipped about himself to Meredith, which adds to the tension between them when they disagree about a mountain climber with an unexplained paralysis. Meanwhile, a psychiatric patient with seemingly psychic powers psychs out Izzie; a pregnant woman with breast cancer befuddles Cristina; George meets his match when he has to intubate a patient; and Burke tells an Orthodox Jewish teenager with a heart defect that only a pig valve can save her(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Who's Zoomin' Who?. An STD outbreak causes chaos. Just as Meredith and Derek get closer, a bombshell is dropped(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.sub-title: Raindrops Keep Falling on My Head
programme.desc: Raindrops Keep Falling on My Head. In the Season 2 opener, Derek's wife, Addison, a surgical superstar from New York, is in Seattle to perform a fetal-heart operation. Derek isn't pleased to see her, and Meredith is feeling very betrayed. Meanwhile, Derek and Burke have some superstar surgery of their own to perform and Webber appoints George to be his "eyes and ears" while he's recovering from surgery(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Enough Is Enough (No More Tears). The OR staff has its hands full with the victims of a spectacular car crash caused by flagrantly careless driver Bob Seibert. In the course of events, it is revealed that Seibert is a drug abuser, wife beater and all-around louse--and he is also in desperate need of a liver transplant. Ironically, the perfect donor turns out to be the very man whom Seibert killed on the road, placing the surgical interns smack in the middle of a major ethical dilemma. Elsewhere, George (T.R. Knight) is forced to work side by side with the same nurse who gave him syphillis; Webber (James Pickens Jr.) gets what-for from his wife (Loretta Devine) for having brain surgery without her knowledge; Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) and Cristina (Sandra Oh) do their best to lose themselves in their work and forget their romantic travails; and we finally find out the reason for the rift between Derek (Patrick Dempsey) and Addison (Kate Walsh)(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Make Me Lose Control. The secret's out when Meredith's mother (Kate Burton) is hospitalized for diverticulitis. And Cristina's secret gets out when she collapses in agony while assisting Burke in surgery. Meanwhile, the Drs. Shepherd work together on the case of a heroin-addicted infant; a young woman who can't stop blushing arrives at the hospital; and George finally finds a way to wield power over Alex(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick operates on a five-month-old rabbit with a badly broken hind leg and diagnoses that a much-loved cocker spaniel needs major spinal surgery. The `Bionic Vet' also meets young couple David and Khaya, who have brought in a three-legged dog that they adopted from Thailand after it was attacked with a machete. Noel knows he must come up with a radical treatment for the animal's remaining front paw, which is injured, and gains inspiration from X-Men's Wolverine for an innovative solution.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Robert Fox and his partner Kevin, who run Cherry Tree House in Blackpool, hope to be in with a chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, two guests are shocked at the room prices, and an afternoon learning clown skills sees a North-South divide develop in the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Caroline Middleton host at the Old Hall Inn in North Yorkshire, where a couple of guests are unimpressed by a discovery in their bathroom, and the afternoon's angling activity leaves two more frustrated when they fail to catch a fish.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to George and Juliet Bristow's Pilot Boat Inn on the Isle of Wight, where some of the guests are amazed by the building - yet others are shocked to find cobwebs in their bedrooms. Also, the hosts' constant hovering at breakfast makes the diners feel uncomfortable.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lucy Roe welcomes her guests to Rutland Terrace in Stamford, Lincolnshire, and although they are delighted with the elegant decor, George and Juliet are unimpressed by their lack of en-suite facilities. Kevin and Robert are horrified by the state of their mattress, before being accused of attention seeking at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of a couple from Yorkshire who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Shelley and David Warner in their search for a property in Daytona, Florida, and shows them what they can get for their £230,000 budget. The Essex couple have high hopes as house prices in the sunshine state have fallen in recent times.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Preston, Lancashire: The Bombers in the Marsh.
programme.desc: Warton Marsh, near Preston in Lancashire, was the scene of a fatal mid-air collision between two American bombers in 1944. An attempt by Tony Robinson and the team to establish the cause of the disaster sees them digging the aircraft out of 6ft of mud and interviewing local eyewitnesses and US pilots.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Drumlanrig, Dumfries: Fighting on the Frontier.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on an excavation close to Drumlanrig Castle, near Dumfries, where the Duke of Buccleuch discovered what he believes may be the remains of a huge Roman fort. They have three days to investigate their host's suspicions - which if confirmed would make it the most northerly example of its type ever found, and change current understanding of Roman history in Scotland.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to operate on Jasper, a 17-week-old Staffie puppy whose legs are growing in the wrong direction, while Labrador Mojo has a spinal problem that will lead to paralysis unless he goes into surgery. Plus, when a cat called Lolli, belonging to nine-year-old Lola, is brought in with a broken pelvis, the `Bionic Vet' must carry out a pioneering procedure to help the animal walk again.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend lead a team of experts as they attempt to renovate a US army Jeep that survived the Second World War but was later damaged in an arson attack. They hope a rapid turnaround on the vehicle will dazzle and surprise its current owner, Dick Masters.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of architect Richard Hawkes and his wife Sophie, as they move from London to the Kent countryside to build a hi-tech eco-friendly house with room to grow their own food. Richard also wants their new home to blend effortlessly into the surrounding countryside, concealed beneath a huge arch of clay tiles covered with earth and planted with grass.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: The firm takes on a new client accused of cyber-terrorism. An accident brings Diane and Kurt together, and Henry reveals new truths about the scandal to Maia. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Mega Yachts
programme.desc: Documentary about the Monaco Yacht Show, where over 100 of the largest yachts on the water are up for sale, with billionaire buyers competing to own the most extravagant vessels. The programme follows those who make, buy and work on these craft, including a Soho businessman planning to sail around the world, a broker with 25 years experience looking to sell a £130 million yacht, and a billionaire installing a crystal chandelier in his floating palace.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. Plus, a man who fell from a ladder and landed on his head, and a widower who had a nasty encounter with a mandoline while chopping vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: The firm takes on a new client accused of cyber-terrorism. An accident brings Diane and Kurt together, and Henry reveals new truths about the scandal to Maia. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. Plus, a man who fell from a ladder and landed on his head, and a widower who had a nasty encounter with a mandoline while chopping vegetables.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jack Osbourne, Uri Geller, Tim Minchin and Holly Walsh join regular team captains Sean Lock and Jason Manford to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of a couple from Yorkshire who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to operate on Jasper, a 17-week-old Staffie puppy whose legs are growing in the wrong direction, while Labrador Mojo has a spinal problem that will lead to paralysis unless he goes into surgery. Plus, when a cat called Lolli, belonging to nine-year-old Lola, is brought in with a broken pelvis, the `Bionic Vet' must carry out a pioneering procedure to help the animal walk again.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four pairs of B&B owners from around Britain take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at the Grange in Oxfordshire, where Graham Neil and his wife Cherry offer a picture-framing course and a morning bagpipe wake-up call. The competing guests are from Ceredigion, Edinburgh and Abingdon-on-Thames.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition reaches its second day and the group visits the village of Llandysul, Ceredigion, to enjoy the hospitality of Katie Clamp and husband Andy. Edinburgh guest-house manager Tony Costa is not happy to find dog hairs on his bed, and Graham Neil is unimpressed after taking a dip in the hot tub. Things seem to get worse when efforts to prepare a hearty breakfast backfire, leading to chaos in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tony and Dawn Ann Costa own the five-star Amar Agua in Edinburgh and pride themselves on their high standards. They decide to entertain their guests with a meal at a leading restaurant and a visit to a subterranean museum, but Katie Clamp keeps complaining and the hosts struggle to keep calm.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Terry and Peter Boswell welcome the group to their Abbey Guest House in Abingdon-on-Thames, Oxfordshire. They organise a day trip to the Thames, but Tony and Katie are still feuding, and the situation only gets worse at dinner as the evening ends in tears.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners discover how the other competitors rated their businesses by opening the cash-filled envelopes, containing what their rivals thought they should receive. They meet for one last time to learn who has won the best value B&B of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps retired couple Paul and Lindy, from the Midlands, search for a suitable property on the Costa del Azahar in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts investigate a mysterious pattern of ditches on the fens near Peterborough, which could mark out a 6,000-year-old religious site. They are joined by historian and broadcaster Francis Pryor as they explore as much of the ancient structure as possible in three days - and try to uncover the mystery of the so-called Neolithic cathedral. Presented by Tony Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: River Hamble, Hampshire: Grace Dieu - In Search of Henry V's Flagship.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew visit Southampton to excavate the remains of a medieval vessel suspected to be Henry V's flagship, the Grace Dieu. With only three days to determine its identity and exact size, Tony and Phil Harding get to work underwater, while ancient-wood expert Damien Goodburn tries to replicate the style of construction used to build the ship.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick takes a look at 12-year-old cat Pixie, who has been hit by a car and brought in by owner Diane. The vet believes he can help the animal walk again with the aid of a revolutionary bionic implant. A Great Dane called Ellie has deformed bones and discs pressing down on her spinal cord, but Noel hopes to relieve the dog's pain by placing bone marrow taken from her shoulder into a special scaffolding in her neck, helping the vertebrae fuse together. Meanwhile, receptionist Natalie introduces a new arrival to the team.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw lead a team of experts who secretly restore classic cars for their unsuspecting owners. They continue by helping widower Jeremy, who was unable to work after a car accident, by giving his Fiat Spider the makeover it deserves.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Brighton couple Daren Howarth and Adi Nortje, who want to build an earth-sheltered home from recycled materials, based on ideas pioneered in New Mexico in the 1970s. However, land prices and planning laws have forced the pair out of England and into Brittany. To keep costs down, Daren and Adi enlist the help of unskilled volunteers to work on the house, in exchange for teaching them the construction techniques.(n)

programme.title: Le Week-End
programme.desc: A couple decide to celebrate their 30th anniversary in Paris, where they spent their honeymoon, in the hope that returning to the site of happier times will revive the failing relationship. The holiday leads to an encounter with a prosperous old friend, who invites them to a dinner party that changes their outlook on life. Romantic comedy drama, starring Jim Broadbent, Lindsay Duncan and Jeff Goldblum.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A retired dockworker who suffers from diabetes is brought in with severe stomach pain. The doctors believe part of his gut may have permanently stopped working, creating a life-threatening situation where dangerous surgery is the only option. Other patients include a man who has twisted his knee dancing in a club, and a cyclist brought in unconscious after falling off his bike.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man is brought in with stomach pains and a suspected abdominal aortic aneurysm. His son receives a huge blow when he is told his father only has a 50 per cent chance of surviving the operation he urgently needs. A 33-year-old is treated after swallowing a cocktail of drugs in a suicide attempt, and staff fight to save a teenager who was stabbed in a street fight and has lost a life-threatening amount of blood.(n)

programme.title: Aftermath: Population Zero
programme.desc: In lieu of honing in on a past or current event (as is the common practice with National Geographic documentaries), this unique program speculates on the future - more specifically, on the dire fate of the Earth in the scenario that all human beings are indiscriminately wiped out by a full-scale cataclysm, such as drought, nuclear war, or the onset of a new ice age. What would the fate of man-made structures be, if suddenly abandoned? How long would it take the ecosphere to rebound from the damage thrust onto it by men and women, in the instance that homo sapiens vanish? These are the sorts of questions posed by Aftermath - Population Zero. The program blends informed commentary from scholars with onscreen computer-generated creations of post-apocalyptic landscapes, to provide an uncompromising view of the Earth, post-mankind(n)

programme.desc: Matchmaker Michelle. Having gone so long without a mother, Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) chooses a new mom for herself, secure in the belief that dad Danny (Bob Saget) will do the right thing and marry the woman. programme.desc: The One Where Joey Loses His Insurance. Having been "at liberty" for too long a period, Joey (David Schwimmer) loses his Screen Actors' Guild health insurance -- just as he injures himself during an audition. Ross' (David Schwimmer) opportunity to lecture at NYU proves to be more rewarding than he expected, but strange complications await him vis-à-vis his quickie Vegas marriage to Rachel (Jennifer Aniston). And Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) is given a disturbing peek into the future by her psychic -- whose own future isn't in very good shape either(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One With Joey's Porsche. When Joey (Matt LeBlanc) finds the keys to an expensive Porsche at Central Perk, he thinks it's a good omen -- and as usual, he begins putting the cart before the horse (or in this case, the Porsche) in a ridiculous fashion. In other developments, Monica (Courteney Cox) and Chandler (Matthew Perry) are finagled into babysitting for Phoebe's (Lisa Kudrow) triplets, a night of terror which ends with Chandler swallowing a toy. And Ross (David Schwimmer) and Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) run into a legal snag as they endeavor to annul their quickie Las Vegas marriage(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One on the Last Night
programme.desc: The One on the Last Night. Monica (Courteney Cox) and Chandler (Matthew Perry) have an emotional time moving out of their respective apartments. Though Chandler is looking forward to moving in with Monica, Joey (Matt LeBlanc) will be left without a roommate. Similarly, Monica is a bit let down that her former roomie Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) is now living with Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow). Somehow or other, this state of affairs also involves Ross (David Schwimmer) and his son, Ben (Cole Sprouse), and a "fixed" game of skill designed to make Joey feel better(n)

programme.title: NCIS

The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Devon for an update on an inspirational build. Royal Marine Captain Jon White and his wife Becky were living happily in a small cottage when in June 2010, while serving in Afghanistan, Jon stepped on an improvised explosive device, losing three limbs. Every part of their lives had to change - starting with where they could live. Their architect came up with a cutting-edge, semi open-plan building with a dramatic wing-like-roof - and crucially no obvious signs of adaptations for Jon's disabilities. Has the new home proved as enabling for the couple and their expanding family as they had hoped?.(n)

The builders have just 10 days to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life - but as usual, local tradesmen and other members of the community turn out in force to help.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: The doctors return to Spain's Costa del Sol, where the mobile clinic is visited by a man worried about a large lump on his testicle. Back in the UK, Dr Dawn Harper tackles a case of a hairy female bottom, and Dr Christian Jessen sees a woman with an embarrassing vaginal discharge. The medics also encounter a man who has to breathe through a hole in his neck, and take to the beach to remind holiday-makers of the dangers of fun in the sun.(n)

programme.title: Millionaire Basement Wars
programme.desc: London's super-rich are maximising their properties as never before, by digging down and creating new basements to house anything from cinemas, swimming pools and squash courts to wine cellars and servants' quarters. However, some take as long as three years to complete - and the noise of the digging, fleets of concrete mixers and builders' lorries has made daily life hell in some of the capital's poshest neighbourhoods. This documentary tells the story of the conflict that has resulted from some of these improvements, going behind the scenes as Kensington council responds to angry residents, and featuring contributions from owners, builders and irate neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: The case of Natasha Cornett, who together with five friends tried to carjack a van, killing the driver, his wife and their six-year-old daughter. Plus, Lasonya Larry, who was convicted of stabbing her boyfriend in their Florida apartment.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp heads to South Africa, 20 years after apartheid was lifted, only to discover that a new set of problems exist, such as a widening gap between rich and poor. However, as he enters the deprived township of Diepsloot on the outskirts of Johannesburg, he discovers an even bigger crisis. Rape has reached epidemic proportions in the country, with statistics showing one in two women born in South Africa will be attacked in their lifetime. Meeting victims and perpetrators, he asks how attitudes to women can change, and what the government can do to curb this abhorrent crime.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK

programme.desc: McGarrett investigates the death of one of the last survivors of the bombing of the USS Arizona at Pearl Harbour, while Adam turns to Jerry when he makes a gruesome discovery.(n)
